label: Holland Branch
description: rises in E Madison County and flows SE into Middle Fork.

label: Hollands Creek
description: rises in W Chatham County and flows SE into Rocky River.

label: Holly Grove
description: community in central Davidson County. See also Conrad Hill.

label: Holly Grove
description: community in NE Gates County.

label: Holly Ridge
description: a raised strip of ground in Dismal Swamp, SE Gates County.

label: Holly Springs
description: community in E Carteret County on Newport River.

label: Holly Springs
description: community in W Henderson County between Boylston and Brock Creeks.

label: Holly Springs
description: community in S Rutherford County; former resort with a hotel.

label: Holly Springs
description: town in S Wake County. Settled 1826; inc. 1877. Named for holly trees growing near a spring in the vicinity. Alt. 350.

label: Honeycutt
description: community in W Johnston County served by post office, 1899-1903.

label: Hooper Branch
description: rises in S Graham County and flows NW into Snowbird Creek.

label: Hopewell
description: community in NW Mecklenburg County. It developed around Hopewell Presbyterian Church, organized 1762.

label: Hopkins
description: community in N Ashe County.

label: Horse Branch
description: rises in SW Beaufort County and flows NE into Chocowinity Creek.

label: Horse Branch
description: rises in W Lenoir County and flows SE into Southwest Creek. The name appears in local records dating from before the Revolution.

label: Horse Cove
description: W Graham County between Little Santeetlah Creek and Rock Creek Knob.

label: Horse Cove
description: NW Henderson County between Beetree Ridge and Big Ridge.

label: Horse Cove
description: SE Macon County, through which Edwards and Blackrock Creeks flow. A post office by the name served the area in the late nineteenth century. Woodrow Wilson, in a letter written from Horse Cove on July 30, 1879, reported that he spent a part of the summer there with his mother and other relatives. John R. Thompson rented summer homes and furnished meals for visitors from New Orleans, Charleston, and other coastal cities. Highlands, which see, was being developed nearby at about the same time.

label: Horse Cove
description: W central Swain County, extends E from Noland Creek between Andreas Branch and Massie Gap.

label: Horse Creek
description: rises in SW Grayson County, Va., and flows SE into N central Ashe County, where it enters North Fork New River.

label: Horse Creek
description: rises in Cherokee County, S.C., and flows NE into Rutherford County, where it enters Broad River.

label: Horse Creek
description: rises in NW Durham County and flows S into North Fork Little River.

label: Horse Creek
description: rises in W Franklin County and flows SW into N Wake County, where it enters Neuse River. Appears on the Collet map, 1770.

label: Horse Creek
description: W Haywood County in Great Smoky Mountains National Park, rises near lat. 35°35'17" N., long. 83°10'40" W., and flows NE to join Bear Branch in forming Rough Creek.

label: Horse Creek
description: rises on Fort Bragg Military Reservation in N Hoke County and flows NE into Little River.

label: Horse Creek
description: rises in S Moore County near town of Pinehurst and flows S into Deep Creek.

label: Horse Creek
description: rises in W central Polk County and flows S into Pacolet River.

label: Horse Gap
description: on the Ashe-Wilkes county line.

label: Horse Gap
description: N Buncombe County between Sheep Knob and Ray Knob.

label: Horse Gap
description: on the McDowell-Yancey county line near the head of Left Prong Three Forks Creek.

label: Horse Island
description: in Core Sound, NE Carteret County. Ruins of a clubhouse exist on the island, and two persons are said to have been murdered there, giving rise to ghost tales.

label: Horse Ridge
description: S Burke County in the South Mountains. Alt. 2,800.

label: Horse Ridge
description: NE Cherokee County in the Valley River Mountains.

label: Horse Ridge
description: SW Macon County between Siler Bald Branch and Factory Branch.

label: Horse Ridge
description: NE Swain County in Great Smoky Mountains National Park, extends SW from Balsam Mountain between Stillwell Creek and Left Fork [Deep Creek].

label: Horse Ridge
description: NW Watauga County, extends N between Rube Creek and Little Beaverdam Creek.

label: Horse Ridge
description: N Yancey County between Seng Branch and Cynthia Branch.

label: Horse Swamp
description: rises in S Hertford County and flows SE and NE to join Flat Swamp in forming Bear Swamp.

label: Horse Swamp
description: rises in E Onslow County and flows NW into Little Northeast Creek.

label: Horse's Creek
description: rises in S Moore County and flows SW into Deep Creek.

label: Horsepen Branch
description: rises in S Greene County and flows SE into Rainbow Creek. The name appears in local records prior to the Revolution.

label: Horsepen Creek
description: rises in NW Columbus County on the Columbus-Robeson-Bladen county lines and flows W into Big Swamp.

label: Horsepen Swamp
description: rises in NW Beaufort County and flows SW into Tranters Creek.

label: Horseshoe
description: community in NW Camden County. Settled shortly after 1700 and formerly known as Newfoundland.

label: Horseshoe Bend
description: a bend in Eagle Creek at the SW end of Big Fork Ridge, NW Swain County.

label: Horseshoe Bend
description: W Swain County in Little Tennessee River.

label: Horseshoe, The
description: bend in Nantahala River, W Macon County.

label: Horton Branch
description: rises in N Cherokee County and flows SW into Beaverdam Creek.

label: Hothouse Branch
description: rises in SW Cherokee County and flows SE into Hot House Creek. Named for the fact that the Indians had "hot houses" in which heated stones were placed for "sweat baths" to refresh fatigued warriors and hunters.

label: Houston Knob
description: E Macon County between Moss Branch and Walnut Creek.

label: Howard Gap
description: S Macon County between Middle Creek and Norton Branch.

label: Howes Point
description: SE Brunswick County on Cape Fear River. Now within the bounds of Sunny Point ammunition depot. Birthplace of Gen. Robert Howe (1732-86).

label: Huckleberry Knob
description: W Haywood County between Deep Gap and Murray Gap.

label: Huckleberry Mountain
description: N Henderson County between Rattlesnake Knob and Kyles Creek. Alt. 2,959.

label: Huckleberry Ridge
description: S Henderson County between Cabin Creek and Rush Mountain. Cited in early county records as Whortleberry Mountain. Formerly a Girl Scout camp and later an artists’ and writers’ summer retreat known as Huckleberry Mountain Artists’ Colony.

label: Huckleberry Ridge
description: NE Macon County between Blazed Creek and Huckleberry Creek.

label: Huckleberry Ridge
description: N Madison County parallel to Rock Branch.

label: Huckleberry Ridge
description: a sandy area on the SW side of Angola Bay, N Pender County.

label: Huff Island
description: SE Bertie County between Middle River and Roanoke River. Approx. 4½ mi. long and 1 mi. wide. See also Purchace Islands.

label: Huggins Creek
description: rises in SW Columbus County and flows S into South Carolina, where it enters Jordan Swamp.

label: Hughes Branch
description: rises in E Macon County and flows SW into Watauga Creek.

label: Hughes Branch
description: rises in N Mitchell County and flows SE into Bean Creek.

label: Hughes Creek
description: rises in N Lee County and flows E into Lick Creek.

label: Hughes Creek
description: rises in NW Mitchell County and flows SW into Hollow Poplar Creek.

label: Hughes Creek
description: rises in S Polk County and flows SE into South Carolina, where it enters Pacolet River.

label: Hughes Gap
description: on the Mitchell County, N.C.-Carter County, Tenn., line.

label: Hughes Ridge
description: E Avery County.

label: Hughes Ridge
description: NE Swain County in Great Smoky Mountains National Park, extends approx. 11 mi. S from Pecks Corner.

label: Huntersville
description: town in N Mecklenburg County. Inc. 1873. Known previously as Hunter's Depot. Named for Robert Hunter, local resident about 1860. Alt. 814.

label: Huntersville
description: See Mount Holly.

label: Hunting Branch
description: rises in Cane Creek Mountains in S Alamance County and flows S into Cane Creek.

label: Hunting Creek
description: rises in central Burke County and flows N through Morganton into Catawba River.

label: Hunting Creek
description: rises in North River Pocosin, S Camden County, and flows E into North River.

label: Hunting Creek
description: rises in N Rutherford County and flows S into Robinson Creek.

label: Hunting Creek
description: rises in S Wilkes County in the Brushy Mountains and flows SE through NE Iredell and W Davie Counties into South Yadkin River. See also Flat Rock Creek; Frohock Sawmill.

label: Hurricane Branch
description: rises in NW Ashe County and flows NE into Horse Creek.

label: Hurricane Branch
description: rises in NE Cherokee County and flows S into Welch Mill Creek.

label: Hurricane Creek
description: rises in central Clay County and flows NW into Tusquitee Creek.

label: Hurricane Creek
description: rises in N Haywood County and flows SW into Pigeon River.

label: Hurricane Creek
description: rises in SW Jackson County and flows NE into Lake Thorpe.

label: Hurricane Creek
description: rises in S Macon County and flows W into Nantahala River.

label: Hurricane Creek
description: rises in W Macon County and flows W into Jarrett Creek.

label: Hurricane Gap
description: central Cherokee County between Hiwassee River and West Prong Grape Creek.

label: Hurricane Gap
description: on the Madison County, N.C.-Greene County, Tenn., line.

label: Hurricane Mountain
description: N Haywood County, extends NE from the head of Toms Branch to the head of Morgan Creek.

label: Hurricane Ridge
description: N Haywood County, extends NE between Hurricane Creek and Cold Springs Creek.

label: Hurricane Ridge
description: N Mitchell County parallel to Big Branch.

label: Hurricane Ridge
description: NW Swain County, a short spur extending W from Big Grill Ridge.

label: Hyatt Creek
description: rises in N Cherokee County in the Snowbird Mountains and flows SE into Valley River.

label: Hyatt Creek
description: rises in SW Haywood County and flows E into Richland Creek.

label: Hyatt Creek
description: rises in NE Swain County on Hyatt Ridge near Hyatt Bald and flows S into Straight Fork.

label: Indian Camp Branch
description: rises in N Buncombe County near Jupiter and flows SW into Shepherd Branch.

label: Indian Camp Branch
description: rises in central Jackson County and flows SE into West Fork [Moses Creek].

label: Indian Camp Branch
description: rises in W Macon County and flows SW into Wine Spring Creek.

label: Indian Camp Branch
description: rises in W Madison County and flows SE into Big Pine Creek.

label: Indian Creek
description: rises in NW Bertie County and flows S into Roanoke River. Creek was the N boundary of the Tuscarora Indian property in Indian Woods Township. Mentioned in local records as early as 1723. Appears as Deep Creek on the Collet map, 1770. See also Resootskeh.

label: Indian Creek
description: rises in SW Catawba County, flows SE across W Lincoln County, dips briefly into NW Gaston County, and flows NE back into Lincoln County, where it enters South Fork Catawba River. Appears on the Collet map, 1770, as Howards Creek but as Indian Creek on the Price map, 1808.

label: Indian Creek
description: rises in S Chatham County and flows SE into Deep River.

label: Indian Creek
description: waterway in NE Currituck County between Knotts Island and Mackay Island.

label: Indian Creek
description: rises in W Hertford County and flows E into Livermans Mill Pond.

label: Indian Creek
description: rises in N Jackson County and flows NW into Soco Creek.

label: Indian Creek
description: rises in W Stokes County and flows NE into Cascade Creek.

label: Indian Creek
description: formed in N Swain County in Great Smoky Mountains National Park by the junction of Left Fork [Indian Creek] and Right Fork [Indian Creek]. It flows SW into Deep Creek.

label: Indian Creek
description: rises in N Swain County and flows S into Noland Creek.

label: Indian Creek
description: rises in W Transylvania County and flows S into Toxaway River.

label: Indian Creek
description: rises in W Transylvania County and flows SW and SE to join Shoal Creek in forming North Fork French Broad River.

label: Indian Creek
description: rises in central Vance County and flows N into Kerr Lake.

label: Indian Grave Gap
description: NE Caldwell County in the Green Mountain range. See also Green Mountain.

label: Indian Grave Gap
description: NE Cherokee County in the Valley River Mountains.

label: Indian Grave Gap
description: SW Cherokee County near the headwaters of Hickey Branch.

label: Indian Grave Gap
description: on the Mitchell County, N.C.-Unicoi County, Tenn., line. Alt. approx. 3,100.

label: Indian Island
description: in Pamlico River, SE Beaufort County. Approx. 1 1/10 mi. long and 3/10 mi. wide.

label: Indian Ridge
description: W Haywood County in Great Smoky Mountains National Park, a spur extending S from Mount Sterling Ridge, center near lat. 35°40' N., long. 83°07'10" W.

label: Indian Ridge
description: SW Macon County between Big Indian Creek and Nantahala River.

label: Indian Swamp
description: rises in S Robeson County and flows S into Ashpole Swamp.

label: Indiantown
description: community in E central Camden County. A post office est. 1882 operated there until 1934. Settled prior to 1697. In 1704 the Governor's Council ordered a reservation to be laid off for the Yeopim Indians, and it is from the reservation that the present name derives.

label: Ingram Branch
description: rises in NE Cherokee County and flows NE into Worm Creek.

label: Iron Mountain
description: NW Mitchell County at the head of Bearwallow Creek.

label: Island Creek
description: rises in SE Alexander County and flows S into Catawba River.

label: Island Creek
description: rises in E Burke County and flows N into Catawba River.

label: Island Creek
description: rises in S Duplin County and flows SE into Northeast Cape Fear River. Appears as Cook Creek on the Collet map, 1770; not shown on the Price map, 1808, but shown and named Island Creek on the MacRae map, 1833.

label: Island Creek
description: a channel of Chowan River flowing N of an unnamed island ¾ mi. long in W Gates County.

label: Island Creek
description: rises in NE Granville County and flows N and NE along the Granville-Vance county line until it reaches the NW corner of Vance County, where it enters Island Creek Reservoir.

label: Island Creek
description: rises in E Jones County and flows N into Trent River. Appears on the Moseley map, 1733, which also shows Murfy's Ferry across the Trent River near the mouth of Island Creek.

label: Island Creek
description: rises in W Montgomery County and flows N and NW into Pee Dee River.

label: Island Creek
description: rises in N New Hanover County and flows NW forming the New Hanover-Pender county line before entering Northeast Cape Fear River.

label: Island Creek
description: rises in SE Rockingham County and flows NE into Caswell County, where it enters Dan River.

label: Island Creek
description: rises in SW Rutherford County and flows NE into Broad River.

label: Island Ford
description: in N Rockingham County within present city of Eden. Eighteenth-century Salem-Petersburg road crossed Smith River there.

label: Island Ford
description: former passage over the Catawba River between Catawba and Iredell Counties near the site of the dam that forms Lookout Shoals Lake, which see. Appears on maps of the Revolutionary period and on the Price map, 1808, as one of the northernmost fords over the river.

label: Ivy Creek
description: is formed in N Buncombe County by the junction of North Fork Ivy Creek and Dillingham Creek and flows W into Madison County (doubling back into Buncombe County at one point), where it joins Little Ivy Creek at the county line to form Ivy River.

label: Ivy Gap
description: on the Buncombe-Yancey county line NW of Cane River Gap.

label: Ivy Gap
description: community in N Haywood County on Mount Sterling Creek.

label: Ivy Gap
description: W Haywood County in Great Smoky Mountains National Park near lat. 35°43'23" N., long. 83°05'10" W.

label: Ivy Gap
description: on the Madison-Yancey county line near Fox Creek. Alt. approx. 3,140.

label: Ivy Knob
description: W Henderson County between Brock Mountain and Cash Creek.

label: Jack Creek
description: rises in central Beaufort County and flows E into Nevil Creek.

label: Jack Creek
description: rises in E Beaufort County and flows NW into Pungo Creek.

label: Jacks Branch
description: rises in W Anson County and flows SE into Brown Creek.

label: Jackson
description: town and county seat, central Northampton County. Alt. 131. Inc. 1873. Settled prior to 1741 and known as Potecase Bridge. Made county seat in 1741 and known as Northampton Court House until renamed Jackson in 1826, presumably for Andrew Jackson (1767-1845), recent unsuccessful Democratic candidate for president. In 1808 the General Assembly had authorized the county seat to be named Atherton, but apparently the name was never adopted. It probably was intended to honor Maj. Jeptha Atherton, member of the Provincial Congress and the General Assembly. Produces lumber.

label: Jackson
description: town authorized in 1818 to be laid off by Isaac Medley, Eustis Hunt, Gideon Johnston, John May Sr., and Joseph Porter "on the north side of Dan river, at the Eagle falls in Rockingham county." The scheme for developing a town there was proved to be a fraud in the case Morehead vs. Hunt, December 1826. See also Eagle Falls.

label: Jackson Creek
description: rises in SE Buncombe County and flows NE into McDowell County, where it enters Crooked Creek.

label: Jackson Creek
description: rises in NW Franklin County and flows N into Tar River.

label: Jackson Creek
description: rises in central Granville County and flows E into Tar River.

label: Jackson Creek
description: rises in W Moore County and flows S into Drowning Creek. Named for William Jackson, who settled on it about 1754.

label: Jackson Creek
description: rises in W Randolph County and flows SE into Uwharrie River.

label: Jackson Knob
description: SE Gaston County approx. 1 mi. SW of Boogertown. Alt. 1,080.

label: Jackson Swamp
description: E Beaufort County.

label: Jackson Township
description: S Nash County.

label: Jackson Township
description: central Northampton County.

label: Jacksonville
description: city and county seat, central Onslow County on New River. Alt. 23. A courthouse was constructed near there about 1757 at Wantland's Ferry. A new courthouse was constructed within Â½ mi. of the old one about 1819, and the county seat was called Onslow Court House. In 1843 the town of Jacksonville was authorized to be est. and inc. there, but it was not immediately done; the act was reenacted in 1849. Named for President Andrew Jackson (1767-1845). Produces lumber and apparel. Camp Lejeune is adjacent. See also Johnston.

label: Jacob Branch
description: rises in central Macon County and flows NE into Rocky Branch.

label: Jacob Branch
description: rises in W Pitt County and flows SE into Black Swamp.

label: Jake Branch
description: rises in SE Clay County and flows NW into Muskrat Branch.

label: James Creek
description: rises in SE Moore County and flows NE into Little River. Named for James McNeill, an early settler.

label: James Creek
description: rises in NE Pamlico County on N Goose Creek Island and flows NE into Pamlico River.

label: Jarrett Creek
description: rises in W McDowell County and flows SE into Catawba River.

label: Jefferson
description: town and county seat, central Ashe County. Inc. 1803 and named for Thomas Jefferson, who was president of the United States at the time. Alt. 2,900. Produces chemicals and textiles.

label: Jefferson
description: town authorized to be laid out in Chatham County at Tyson's Mill on Deep River in 1796. Commissioners were appointed, but there is no evidence that the town ever developed. A warehouse was to have been erected in the town for the inspection of tobacco, beef, pork, flour, and other commodities.

label: Jefferson Township
description: central Ashe County.

label: Jenkins Branch
description: rises in SE Buncombe County and flows W into Rock Creek.

label: Jenkins Cove
description: NE Cherokee County. An unnamed stream flows NW in the cove.

label: Jericho
description: community in S Caswell County. A post office operated there, 1904-17.

label: Jericho
description: community in S Davie County near the head of Baxter Creek. Named for the Jericho Church of Christ, est. there in 1872. A post office that operated there, 1900-1902, was known as Kurfees.

label: Jerome
description: community in NW Bladen County.

label: Jim Branch
description: rises in S Buncombe County and flows NW into Christian Creek.

label: Jim Branch
description: rises in W Haywood County and flows NW into Rough Fork.

label: Jim Creek
description: rises near Stone Mountain in SW Henderson County and flows SW into Grassy Creek.

label: Jinnys Branch
description: rises in SW Brunswick County and flows E and S into Shallotte Inlet.

label: Joes Creek
description: rises in S Richmond County and flows SE onto the Richmond-Scotland county line and SE into Scotland County, where it enters Gum Swamp Creek. See also Rochdale.

label: Johns Branch
description: rises in W Graham County and flows SE into Santeetlah Creek.

label: Johns Cove
description: S Haywood County on Crawford Creek.

label: Johnson Branch
description: rises in E Clay County and flows NW into Davenport Branch.

label: Johnson Branch
description: rises in W Haywood County and flows N into Campbell Creek.

label: Johnson Branch
description: rises in W Macon County and flows E into Nantahala Lake.

label: Johnson Branch
description: rises in N Madison County and flows W into Shelton Laurel Creek.

label: Johnson Branch
description: rises in E Swain County and flows S into Tuckasegee River.

label: Johnson Cove
description: SE Buncombe County E of Turkey Ridge.

label: Johnson Creek
description: a tidal creek in Core Sound near the Core Banks, E Carteret County.

label: Johnson Creek
description: rises in N Granville County and flows E into Grassy Creek basin of Kerr Lake.

label: Johnson Creek
description: rises in S Granville County and flows SE into Aycock Creek.

label: Johnson Gap
description: N Graham County between tributaries of Sawyer Creek and Stecoah Creek.

label: Johnson Gap
description: W Haywood County between Johnson Branch and Pine Tree Cove.

label: Johnson Pond
description: N Harnett County on West Buies Creek. Approx. ½ mi. long.

label: Johnsonville
description: community in SW Cherokee County at the mouth of Hothouse Branch.

label: Johnsonville
description: community in W Harnett County named for Samuel Johnson, early innkeeper there. Surrounding elevated lands first known as Mount Pleasant by Highland Scots who settled there in the 1750s. Name changed later to Camerons Hill for Daniel Cameron, who lived nearby. Afterward changed to its present name. Flora MacDonald, Scottish heroine, lived there, 1774-75. In a mound 4 mi. W are buried over 100 Indians, victims of a massacre shortly before the area was settled by Scots. The mound has been vandalized.

label: Jolly Branch
description: rises in SW Cleveland County and flows S beside Jolly Mountain into Broad River.

label: Jonas Ridge
description: mountain range in NW Burke County. Named for Jonas Braswell, an early settler who froze to death there.

label: Jones Branch
description: rises in SW Buncombe County near Jones Mountain and flows W into Newfound Creek.

label: Jones Branch
description: rises in NE Cherokee County and flows SE into Ricket Branch.

label: Jones Branch
description: rises in central Haywood County and flows NW into Pigeon River.

label: Jones Branch
description: rises in W Madison County and flows NE into East Fork Shut-in Creek.

label: Jones Chapel
description: community in NW Martin County.

label: Jones Cove
description: central Haywood County near the head of Jones Branch.

label: Jones Creek
description: rises in SW Avery County and flows E into North Toe River.

label: Jones Creek
description: rises in SE Buncombe County and flows SE into Broad River.

label: Jones Creek
description: rises in NE Jackson County and flows W into Dark Ridge Creek.

label: Jones Creek
description: rises in S Macon County and flows N into Cartoogechaye Creek.

label: Jones Creek
description: rises in E Rockingham County and flows E into Lower Hogans Creek. Appears as Pruetts Fork Creek in early records; known as Manly Mill Creek in the 1920s and more recently by its present name.

label: Jones Creek
description: rises in NE Swain County and flows SW into Raven Fork.

label: Jones Creek
description: rises in S Swain County and flows NW into Bowers Creek.

label: Jones Gap
description: S Macon County between Cadon Gap and the head of Stephens Creek.

label: Jones Island
description: in White Oak River, W Carteret County, near the mouth of Pettivers Creek. Named for Robert Jones.

label: Jones Island
description: See Harwells Island.

label: Jones Knob
description: N Buncombe County at the N end of Iron Ore Ridge in the Elk Mountains.

label: Jones Knob
description: SW Cherokee County between Rocky Ford Creek and Shoal Creek.

label: Jones Knob
description: on the Haywood-Jackson county line. Alt. 6,240-6,260. Formerly known as Jones's Folly because, at a time when Elisha Mitchell and Thomas Clingman were contending over the highest peak in the southern Appalachians, a man named Jones came into the area and reported the knob to be the highest mountain. Upon questioning him, his friends discovered that he had not been near the top, so they called it Jones's Folly. In the 1850s, Arnold Guyot tried to name the peak Mount Junaluska, but the name did not stick.

label: Jones Knob
description: W Jackson County between Windy Gap and Poplar Cove Knob. Alt. approx. 4,140.

label: Jones Mill
description: appears on the Collet map, 1770. It was located near the mouth of the stream in SW Camden County that is now known as Portohonk Creek.

label: Jones Mill
description: community in E Cherokee County on Peachtree Creek.

label: Jones Mill
description: See Barrows Mill Pond.

label: Jones Mountain
description: central Buncombe County W of Wilson.

label: Jones Pond
description: a natural lake in E Gates County fed by several small streams and emptying into the Dismal Swamp. It is about ¾ mi. long and 2 to 6 ft. deep.

label: Jones Swamp
description: W central Gates County drained by Flat Branch.

label: Joppa
description: community in W Orange County served by post office, 1888-1905.

label: Jordan Branch
description: rises in W Gates County and flows NW into Lassiter Branch.

label: Jordan Creek
description: rises in S Caswell County and flows SW into N Alamance County, where it enters Stony Creek.

label: Jordan Creek
description: rises in E Beaufort County and flows E into Pungo River. Appears on the Collet map, 1770. See also Chappel Creek.

label: Jordans Creek
description: rises in N Scotland County and flows SE into Juniper Creek.

label: Jugtown
description: community in SW Buncombe County.

label: Jugtown
description: former community in SW Catawba County near the Lincoln County line. An area approx. 8 mi. square in which pottery was made from the early nineteenth century. Jacob Weaver, German potter, began the work and used a secret color formula, which he never shared with anyone else. Hilton, Reinhardt, Hartsoe, Johnson, Propst, Ritchie, and Seagle families and others also worked there.

label: Jumping Run
description: rises in E Burke County and flows N into Catawba River.

label: Jumping Run
description: a stream about 1 mi. long, rises in S Carteret County and flows E and then S into the N side of Bogue Sound about 4 mi. E of Broad Creek.

label: Jumping Run
description: rises in central Franklin County and flows SW into Tar River.

label: Jumping Run
description: rises in S Franklin County and flows NE into Crooked Creek.

label: Jumping Run
description: rises on the Fort Bragg Military Reservation in NE Hoke County and flows NE into Little River.

label: Jumping Run
description: rises in SW Johnston County and flows NE into Mill Creek.

label: Jumping Run
description: rises in N Lenoir County and flows SW into Falling Creek. The woodland pond forming the headwaters of the stream has been called The Hanted Pond since 1730.

label: Jumping Run
description: rises in S New Hanover County and flows W into Greenfield Lake.

label: Jumping Run
description: rises in SE Onslow County and flows W into Frenchs Creek.

label: Jumping Run
description: rises in E Pender County and flows W into Northeast Cape Fear River.

label: Jumping Run Creek
description: rises in central Alexander County and flows SW into Glade Creek. Name appears in local records as early as 1790.

label: Juniper Creek
description: rises in Green Swamp in N central Brunswick County. It flows W and SW into Waccamaw River. For a distance of several mi., it forms a part of the boundary between Brunswick and Columbus Counties.

label: Juniper Creek
description: rises in E Harnett County and flows SW into Cape Fear River.

label: Juniper Creek
description: rises on the Fort Bragg Military Reservation in N Hoke County and flows S into Rockfish Creek.

label: Juniper Creek
description: rises in S Lee County and flows NE into Little River.

label: Juniper Creek
description: rises in S Nash County and flows E into NW Wilson County, where it joins Millstone Creek in forming Bloomery Swamp.

label: Juniper Creek
description: rises in N Scotland County and flows SE into Big Shoeheel Creek.

label: Juniper Swamp
description: rises in S Johnston County and flows SE into Hannah Creek.

label: Juniper Swamp
description: rises in N Onslow County and flows S into Cowhorn Swamp.

label: Kelly
description: community in SE Bladen County. Formerly known also as Centerville and Hungry Neck.

label: Kennedy Creek
description: rises in NE Cherokee County and flows NE and W into Worm Creek.

label: Kerr
description: community in New Hanover County.

label: Kilby Branch
description: rises in N Haywood County and flows SE into Big Creek.

label: Kilby Gap
description: on the Alexander-Wilkes county line in the Brushy Mountains. Named for William Kilby Jr., early nineteenth-century resident of the area. Alt. 1,540.

label: Killian Knob
description: central Buncombe County near Gooch Peak N of Asheville.

label: Kimsey Cove
description: NE Cherokee County in the Valley River Mountains. An unnamed stream flowing through the cove empties into Vengeance Creek.

label: Kimsey Creek
description: rises in S Buncombe County and flows SW into Henderson County, where it enters Cane Creek. A large lime deposit along Kimsey Creek is now used for crushed stone.

label: King Creek
description: rises in NE Craven County and flows N into Neuse River.

label: King Creek
description: rises in S Henderson County and flows NE into Bat Fork.

label: King Mountain
description: S Henderson County N of Zirconia.

label: King Mountain
description: SW Randolph County.

label: Kings Creek
description: rises in NW Alleghany County and flows SW into South Fork New River.

label: Kings Creek
description: rises in NE Caldwell County and flows N into Yadkin River. Has been known by the name since the colonial period, hence it probably honors King George III.

label: Kings Creek
description: rises in NW Guilford County and flows W into Forsyth County, where it enters East Belews Creek.

label: Kings Creek
description: rises in S Onslow County and flows SE into Spicers Bay.

label: Kings Creek
description: rises in S Vance County and flows S into N Franklin County, where it enters Tar River.

label: Kings Crossroads
description: community in NW Guilford County.

label: Kings Mountain
description: a range about 3 mi. long in SE Cleveland and SW Gaston Counties extending into South Carolina. The highest peak, The Pinnacle, is at the N end of the range, separated from the rest of the range by Sherrars Gap. The Battle of Kings Mountain, October 7, 1780, was fought a short distance S in South Carolina.

label: Kirkland Creek
description: formed in S Swain County by the confluence of West Fork and East Fork and flows NE into Tuckasegee River.

label: Knights Crossroads
description: community in W Halifax County.

label: Knob Creek
description: rises in SW Jackson County and flows E into Norton Creek.

label: Lake Junaluska
description: central Haywood County on Richland Creek. Formerly covered 250 acres, but silt filled it until it is much smaller. Named for the Cherokee Indian chief, Junaluska (ca. 1758-1858). The lake covers the site of the former community of Tuscola, which had a post office in the 1870s and 1880s.

label: Lake Louise
description: a 35-acre lake formed in 1927 in SE Alleghany County on the headwaters of Laurel Branch. Owned by Roaring Gap, Inc., and open exclusively to stockholders and guests for fishing, swimming, and boating.

label: Lake Lure
description: W Rutherford County on Broad River. Formed in 1928 as a part of a resort development; the dam is 104 ft. high. The lake covers 1,500 acres, with a shoreline of 27 mi. Used for recreation.

label: Lake Waccamaw
description: a natural lake in NE Columbus County, 5 mi. long and 3 mi. wide. Surrounding area drains into the lake; appears on Moseley map, 1733. Named for local tribe of Indians.

label: Lamb Mountain
description: E Henderson County between Lewis Creek and Mills Gap.

label: Lassiter
description: community in SW Randolph County served by post office, 1848-1933. Known as Lassiter's Mills until 1894.

label: Latham
description: community in NW Beaufort County.

label: Laurel
description: community in N Franklin County.

label: Laurel Branch
description: rises in SE Alleghany County and flows SW then NE into Brush Creek.

label: Laurel Branch
description: rises in W Avery County and flows SW into Roaring Creek.

label: Laurel Branch
description: rises in S Buncombe County and flows SE into Bent Creek.

label: Laurel Branch
description: rises in SE Buncombe County and flows SW into Broad River.

label: Laurel Branch
description: rises in SE Buncombe County near Flat Top Mountain and flows S into Cane Creek.

label: Laurel Branch
description: rises in NE Cherokee County on Brushy Head Mountain and flows NW into Burnt Branch.

label: Laurel Branch
description: rises in S Cherokee County and flows NW into Nottely River.

label: Laurel Branch
description: rises in S Clay County and flows N into Shooting Creek.

label: Laurel Branch
description: rises in N central Haywood County S of Chestnut Flat Ridge and flows E to join Pigeon River opposite Solray Gap.

label: Laurel Branch
description: rises in N Haywood County on E slopes of Cowpen Top and flows NE into Waterville Lake.

label: Laurel Branch
description: rises in N Haywood County on S slopes of Ed Top and flows SW into SE part of Waterville Lake.

label: Laurel Branch
description: rises in N Henderson County and flows SE into Bold Branch.

label: Laurel Branch
description: rises in W Jackson County and flows N into Tuckasegee River.

label: Laurel Branch
description: rises in S Macon County and flows NE into Cullasaja River.

label: Laurel Branch
description: rises in W Macon County and flows NW into Rowlin Creek.

label: Laurel Branch
description: rises in W Macon County and flows SE into Nantahala Lake.

label: Laurel Branch
description: rises in E Mitchell County and flows S into Cane Creek.

label: Laurel Branch
description: rises in N Swain County and flows SW then E into Noland Creek.

label: Laurel Branch
description: rises in NW Swain County and flows SE into Tub-Mill Creek.

label: Laurel Branch
description: rises in W Swain County and flows W into Fontana Lake near the confluence of Hazel Creek.

label: Laurel Branch
description: rises in S Transylvania County and flows SW into East Fork French Broad River.

label: Laurel Branch
description: rises in W Transylvania County and flows NE into West Fork French Broad River.

label: Laurel Branch
description: rises in W Transylvania County and flows W into North Fork French Broad River.

label: Laurel Branch
description: rises in N Watauga County and flows SE into Cove Creek.

label: Laurel Branch
description: rises in S Watauga County and flows NW into Sawpit Branch.

label: Laurel Branch
description: rises in S central Yancey County and flows W into Cane River.

label: Laurel Branch
description: rises in S Yancey County and flows NE into South Toe River.

label: Laurel Creek
description: rises in SE Burke County and flows SE parallel to Prospect Ridge into Henry Fork.

label: Laurel Creek
description: rises in central Cherokee County near Fain Mountain and flows SW into Hiwassee River.

label: Laurel Creek
description: rises in W Cherokee County and flows NE into Apalachia Lake.

label: Laurel Creek
description: rises in SE Durham County and flows NE into Lick Creek.

label: Laurel Creek
description: rises in N Haywood County and flows NW into Big Creek.

label: Laurel Creek
description: rises in E Macon County and flows S into Ellijay Creek.

label: Laurel Creek
description: rises in NE Mitchell County and flows S into Little Rock Creek.

label: Laurel Creek
description: rises in E Transylvania County and flows NE into Cascade Lake (Little River).

label: Laurel Creek
description: rises in NE Transylvania County and flows SE into Henderson County, where it enters South Fork.

label: Laurel Creek
description: rises in NW Wake County near Little Laurel Creek and flows NE into Big Lick Creek.

label: Laurel Creek
description: rises in S Watauga County and flows N into Boone Fork.

label: Laurel Fork
description: rises in central Buncombe County and flows N into Reems Creek.

label: Laurel Fork Creek
description: rises in SW Alleghany and SE Ashe Counties and flows N to join Meadow Fork Creek in forming Mulberry Creek.

label: Laurel Gap
description: in Locust Ridge, NE Buncombe County.

label: Laurel Gap
description: between Rocky Knob and Glade Ridge in E Haywood County.

label: Laurel Gap
description: on the Haywood-Swain county line in Great Smoky Mountains National Park on Balsam Mountain between Balsam High Top and Balsam Corner, near lat. 35°39'55" N., long. 83°11'15" W. Alt. approx. 5,400.

label: Laurel Gap
description: on the Jackson-Macon county line.

label: Laurel Hill
description: community in SW Buncombe County near Beaverdam.

label: Laurel Hill
description: community in NW Lincoln County.

label: Laurel Knob
description: mountain between Double Knob Mountain and Cowrock Mountain in S Jackson County. Alt. approx. 4,300.

label: Laurel Mountain
description: extends SE in an arc from Sassafras Gap to Yellow Gap in NW Henderson County.

label: Laurel Mountain
description: N Transylvania County between Cantrell Creek and Laurel Gap.

label: Laurel Ridge
description: N Buncombe County between Laurel Fork and Sugarcamp Fork.

label: Laurel Ridge
description: at the SE end of Laurel Mountain in NW Henderson County.

label: Laurel Ridge
description: on the Madison-Yancey county line N of Big Laurel Creek.

label: Laurel Ridge
description: in NE Mitchell County between Laurel Creek and Holder Creek.

label: Laurel Ridge
description: W Mitchell County between Bird Creek and Pate Creek.

label: Laurel Top
description: peak on Graham County, N.C.-Monroe County, Tenn., line. Alt. approx. 5,325.

label: Lawsonville
description: community in E Rockingham County between Lick Fork and Jones Creeks. Named for Bobbie Lawson, early resident and subject of popular local legend. Lawson's Store post office operated there, 1817-23 and 1830-45. Site of several early tobacco factories and a carriage and wagon factory.

label: Leatherwood Branch
description: rises in W Clay County and flows SE into Fires Creek.

label: Ledford Branch
description: rises in S Cherokee County and flows NW into Nottely River.

label: Ledford Branch
description: rises in SW Clay County and flows sw, nw, then SW again into Brasstown Creek.

label: Ledford Creek
description: rises in S Buncombe County and flows SE into Bent Creek.

label: Ledge Creek
description: rises in SW Granville County just NW of town of Stem, flows S through Creedmoor Lake W of town of Creedmoor, and empties into Neuse River at Durham-Wake county line. Appears as Ledge of Rocks Creek on the Collet map, 1770, and others.

label: Lee Creek
description: rises in central Buncombe County near Spivey Mountain and flows NE into French Broad River.

label: Leesville
description: former community in S Robeson County between Hog Swamp and Oldfield Swamp. A post office existed there from ca. 1816 to 1900. The name is still used in the county with reference to the general area.

label: Leo
description: community in S Stanly County served by post office, 1858-1907.

label: Leonard Creek
description: rises in central Davidson County and flows S into Abbotts Creek.

label: Lewis
description: community in E Granville County. Named for Willis Lewis, local doctor. Alt. 545.

label: Lewis Branch
description: rises in E central Brunswick County and flows N into Lewis Swamp.

label: Lewis Branch
description: rises in NW Jackson County and flows NE into Tuckasegee River.

label: Lewis Creek
description: an inlet of Core Sound into SE Cedar Island in NE Carteret County.

label: Lewis Creek
description: rises on SE Core Banks and flows N into Core Sound in SE Carteret County.

label: Lewis Creek
description: rises in E Henderson County and flows NW into Clear Creek.

label: Lewis Creek
description: rises in S Onslow County and flows NE into Morgan Bay. Mentioned in local records as early as 1744 as Lewis's Creek.

label: Lewisville
description: former town in SE Columbus County. Inc. 1885, but long inactive in municipal affairs. Two rural service stations now mark the site.

label: Liberty
description: town in NE Randolph County. Inc. 1889. Named for the nearby plantation of John Leak, who settled there in 1807. Alt. 790.

label: Liberty Hill
description: former community in central Guilford County, now a part of Greensboro.

label: Liberty Township
description: NE Randolph County.

label: Lick Creek
description: rises in SW Anson County and flows N into Brown Creek.

label: Lick Creek
description: rises in N Chatham County and flows N across the county line into Alamance County for a short distance before turning S again into Chatham County, where it enters Terrell Creek.

label: Lick Creek
description: rises in E Davidson County and flows SW into Yadkin River.

label: Lick Creek
description: rises S Durham County and flows NE into Neuse River. Once known as Great Lick Creek.

label: Lick Creek
description: rises in E Montgomery County and flows NE into Cotton Creek.

label: Lick Creek
description: rises in N Forsyth County and flows NE into S Stokes County, where it enters Town Fork Creek. Probably named for a salt lick frequented by deer; the name appears in records as early as 1755.

label: Lick Fork
description: rises in N Forsyth County and flows SW into Mill Creek. Appears as Jones Creek on the Collet map, 1770; not named on subsequent maps until it appears as Little Lick Fork on MacRae map, 1833.

label: Lick Fork Creek
description: rises in W Montgomery County and flows SW into Clarks Creek.

label: Lick Log Creek
description: rises in central Clay County and flows SW into Lake Chatuge. The name originated when the Davis family, early settlers, felled trees and cut notches in the logs to hold salt for their cattle.

label: Lick Mountain
description: S Caldwell County. Alt. 1,990.

label: Lick Mountain
description: W Montgomery County near Dutchmans Creek.

label: Licklog Creek
description: rises in N Jackson County and flows NW into Scott Creek.

label: Licklog Gap
description: SE Buncombe County in the Swannanoa Mountains between Lookoff Gap and Jesses High Top.

label: Licklog Gap
description: NW Burke County. Alt. 2,420.

label: Licklog Gap
description: on the Haywood-Jackson county line. Takes its name from a "licklog" formerly there, a log with boxes chopped into its upper side to hold salt for the cattle to lick.

label: Licklog Gap
description: in S Macon County between Grassy Knobs and Middle Creek.

label: Licklog Gap
description: in W Macon County at the head of Whiteoak Creek.

label: Lickskillet
description: community in S Macon County between the head of Tessentee Creek and Piney Knob Fork. Named by hunters who left unwashed cooking pans in camp and returned to find that they had been licked by dogs or other animals.

label: Limekiln Creek
description: rises in W Gaston County and flows SW into Long Creek.

label: Limestone Creek
description: rises in S Buncombe County and flows S into Merrill Cove Creek.

label: Limestone Township
description: S central Buncombe County. A post office named Limestone existed in Buncombe County as early as 1828.

label: Linville Creek
description: rises in central Watauga County and flows SW in an arc into Brushy Fork.

label: Linville Falls
description: NW Burke County on Linville River approx. 2 mi. S of the Avery-Burke county line. In 1876 there were two distinct falls, each approx. 35 ft. high. In the early 1900s, the lower ledge gave way, so that now the upper falls cascade over a smooth, 12 ft. rock shelf, and the water then drops 90 ft. at the lower falls into a rock-encircled pool at the head of Linville Gorge. Reached by foot trail near the Blue Ridge Parkway. Named for William and John Linville, killed by Indians below the falls in 1766.

label: Linville Township
description: central Avery County.

label: Lisbon
description: community in S central Bladen County, was the plantation of Col. John Slingsby, Tory commander at the Battle of Elizabethtown, at which he was fatally wounded.

label: Little Bald
description: on the Cherokee-Graham county line in the Snowbird Mountains.

label: Little Bald
description: SE Clay County. Alt. 5,030.

label: Little Bald
description: E Graham County at the head of Franks Creek.

label: Little Bald
description: E Mitchell County between High Knob and Wiggins Cove.

label: Little Bald Branch
description: rises in W Haywood County and flows NE into Caldwell Fork.

label: Little Bald Knob
description: W Haywood County in Great Smoky Mountains National Park on Cataloochee Divide between Sheepback Knob and Fie Creek, near lat. 35°33'05" N., long. 83°07'10" W.

label: Little Bald Mountain
description: on the Haywood-Transylvania county line on the Pisgah Ridge. Alt. 5,280-5,320.

label: Little Bald Mountain
description: SW Macon County, extends SE from Runaway Knob to the head of Long Branch. Alt. 5,217.

label: Little Bald Mountain
description: on the Madison County, N.C.-Greene County, Tenn., line.

label: Little Bear Creek
description: rises in S Mitchell County and flows SW into North Toe River.

label: Little Beaverdam Creek
description: rises in NW Gaston County and flows NE into Beaverdam Creek.

label: Little Beaverdam Creek
description: rises in SE Granville County and flows SW into Wake County, where it enters Beaverdam Creek.

label: Little Branch
description: rises in W Haywood County and flows SE into Winchester Creek.

label: Little Branch
description: rises in N Johnston County and flows SE into Swift Creek.

label: Little Brown Creek
description: rises in SW Anson County and flows N into Brown Creek.

label: Little Brush Creek
description: rises in SW Chatham County and flows SW into Randolph County, where it enters Brush Creek.

label: Little Buck Creek
description: rises in NW Burke County and flows NE into Steele's Creek.

label: Little Buck Creek
description: rises in SE Clay County and flows SW into Buck Creek.

label: Little Buck Creek
description: rises in E Macon County and flows SW into Buck Creek.

label: Little Buffalo Creek
description: rises in E Johnston County and flows SE into Little River.

label: Little Buffalo Creek
description: rises in central Lee County and flows N into Deep River.

label: Little Buffalo Creek
description: rises in SW Lincoln County and flows SW into Cleveland County, where it enters Buffalo Creek.

label: Little Buffalo Creek
description: rises in NW Richmond County and flows SW into Buffalo Creek.

label: Little Buffalo Creek
description: rises in S Vance County and flows SW into Buffalo Creek.

label: Little Buffalo Creek
description: rises in S Rowan and N Cabarrus Counties and flows SW into Dutch Buffalo Creek.

label: Little Creek
description: rises in SW Alamance County and flows N into Stinking Quarter Creek.

label: Little Creek
description: rises in N Anson County and flows N into Rocky River.

label: Little Creek
description: rises in SE Anson County and flows S into Jones Creek.

label: Little Creek
description: rises in SE Beaufort County and flows NW into South Creek.

label: Little Creek
description: is shown on the Collet map, 1770, as flowing parallel to the present Broad Creek of Camden County, though S of it. The creek N of the present Broad Creek is probably intended, as there is no parallel stream S of it.

label: Little Creek
description: rises in Black Swamp on the S tip of Camden County and flows N into North River.

label: Little Creek
description: rises in S Carteret County and flows S into Newport River.

label: Little Creek
description: rises in NW Cumberland County and flows N into Little River.

label: Little Creek
description: rises in W Davie County and flows SE approx. 6 mi. into South Yadkin River.

label: Little Creek
description: is formed in SE Orange County by the junction of Booker Creek and Bolin Creek; it flows E into SW Durham County, where it flows SE into New Hope Creek.

label: Little Creek
description: rises in the SW section of Winston-Salem, central Forsyth County, and flows SW into Muddy Creek. Appears as Loar Creek on the Collet map, 1770; as Long Run on the Price map, 1808; and under its present name on the MacRae map, 1833.

label: Little Creek
description: rises in S Franklin County and flows NE into Crooked Creek.

label: Little Creek
description: rises in E Haywood County and flows SW into Bald Creek.

label: Little Creek
description: rises in N Johnston County and flows SE into Little River. Appears on the Collet map, 1770.

label: Little Creek
description: rises in NW Johnston County and flows SE into Swift Creek.

label: Little Creek
description: rises in N Lincoln County and flows NE into Catawba River.

label: Little Creek
description: rises in SE Macon County and flows SE into Big Creek.

label: Little Creek
description: rises in NE Madison County and flows S into Big Laurel Creek.

label: Little Creek
description: rises in SW Madison County and flows NE into Spring Creek.

label: Little Creek
description: rises in W Madison County and flows E into Meadow Fork.

label: Little Creek
description: rises in E central Moore County and flows NW into McLendons Creek.

label: Little Creek
description: rises in SW Nash County and flows SW into Moccasin Creek.

label: Little Creek
description: rises in W Stanly County and flows SW into Big Bear Creek.

label: Little Creek
description: rises in N Stokes County and flows SW into Peters Creek.

label: Little Creek
description: rises in W Surry County and flows SE into Snow Creek.

label: Little Creek
description: rises in E Wake County and flows SE into N Johnston County, where it enters Moccasin Creek.

label: Little Creek
description: rises in E Johnston County and flows NE into Wilson County, where it enters Contentnea Creek.

label: Little Creek
description: rises in N Yancey County and flows SE into Cane River.

label: Little Cypress Creek
description: rises in E Franklin County and flows SW into Cypress Creek.

label: Little Deep Creek
description: rises in S Halifax County and flows SE into Deep Creek.

label: Little Elk Creek
description: rises in W Alleghany County and flows N into Elk Creek.
