label: Midway
description: community in S Rockingham County. Took its name form local Methodist church.

label: Midway
description: former community in W Vance County located at the crossroads now approx. 1 mi. SW of Hicks Crossroads. Appears on the MacRae map, 1833. So named because it was located approx. midway between Williamsboro and Oxford.

label: Midway
description: See Eller.

label: Miles
description: community in SE Alleghany County between Bucks Peak and Stone Mountain.

label: Milksick Cove
description: SW Buncombe County, the valley through which the W tributary of Pole Creek flows.

label: Milksick Cove
description: central Clay County near Chatuge Lake.

label: Mill Branch
description: rises in E Cherokee County and flows SW into Peachtree Creek.

label: Mill Branch
description: rises in NE Cherokee County and flows S into Valley River.

label: Mill Branch
description: rises in NE Cherokee County and flows SE into Valley River.

label: Mill Branch
description: rises in E Clay County and flows NW into Perry Creek.

label: Mill Branch
description: rises in E Clay County near Boteler Peak and flows SE into Shooting Creek.

label: Mill Branch
description: rises in SW Columbus County and flows E into Gum Swamp.

label: Mill Branch
description: rises in Great Dover Swamp, W Craven County, and flows E into Cove Creek.

label: Mill Branch
description: rises in S Duplin County and flows SE into Pagets Branch.

label: Mill Branch
description: rises in SE Duplin County and flows SW into Cypress Creek.

label: Mill Branch
description: rises in central Hertford County and flows NW into Potecasi Creek.

label: Mill Branch
description: rises in W Johnston County and flows S into Middle Creek.

label: Mill Branch
description: rises in W Jones County and flows SE into Trent River.

label: Mill Branch
description: rises in S Macon County and flows NE into Cunningham Creek.

label: Mill Branch
description: rises in N Martin County and flows N into Conoho Creek.

label: Mill Branch
description: rises in NW Swain County and flows SE into Bone Valley Creek.

label: Mill Branch
description: rises in W Swain County and flows SW into Fontana Lake.

label: Mill Branch
description: rises in W Transylvania County and flows SE into West Fork French Broad River.

label: Mill Branch
description: rises on the Johnston-Wayne county line and flows NE into Mill Creek.

label: Mill Branch
description: rises in S Wilson County and flows E into Contentnea Creek.

label: Mill Branch
description: rises in W Wilson County and flows SE into Shepherd's Branch. Apparently once known as Big Branch.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in E Alamance County and flows W into Back Creek.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in NE Alamance County and flows S into Stag's Creek.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in NE Alexander County and flows S into South Yadkin River.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in S Anson County and flows NE into Pee Dee River.

label: Mill Creek
description: community in E central Brunswick County.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in NE Brunswick County and flows SE into Brunswick River.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in NW Cabarrus County and flows S into Coddle Creek. See also Mill Hill.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises at the foot of the Green Mountain range in central Caldwell County and flows SE into Zacks Fork Creek. Named because several mills once were operated along its course.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in SE Caldwell County and flows S into Upper Little River on the Caldwell-Alexander County line.

label: Mill Creek
description: community in S central Carteret County at the mouth of Mill Creek on the N shore of Newport River. Formerly known as Bordensville for William Borden, an early Quaker settler who operated a shipyard there.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in central Carteret County and flows S into the estuary of Newport River.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in E Carteret County and flows S and SE into the headwaters of Newport River.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in W Cherokee County and flows W into Hiwassee River.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in S Clay County and flows NE into Hiwassee River.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in N Forsyth County and flows S into Muddy Creek.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in W Henderson County and flows SW into Crab Creek.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in central Hoke County and flows NE into Rockfish Creek.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in SE Hoke County and flows NE into Rockfish Creek.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in central Jackson County and flows NW into Trout Creek.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in N Jackson County and flows SW into Tuckasegee River.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in SW Jackson County and flows NE into Lake Thorpe.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in N Johnston County and flows S into Neuse River.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in S Johnston County and flows NE into Neuse River.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in S Jones County and flows N into Trent River. Appears on the Moseley map, 1733, which also shows Franks Ferry across the Trent River near the mouth of Mill Creek.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in central Macon County and flows SE into Cartoogechaye Creek.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in SE Macon County and flows NE into Mirror Lake.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in N Madison County and flows SW into Shelton Laurel Creek.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in W McDowell County and flows SE into Catawba River.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in SE Moore County and flows E to join McDeeds Creek in forming Shaddock's Creek.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in W Moore County and flows NE into Cabin Creek. In 1754 it was originally called Smiths Mill Creek for "Sandhill" John Smith, who had a mill there. Later called Tillis's Mill Creek for Richard Tillis, who bought the mill from Smith. Still later called Sowell's Mill Creek for another owner, a name by which it is also sometimes known today.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in central Onslow County and flows S into Stones Bay.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in E Onslow County and flows SE into Bear Creek.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in N Onslow County and flows SW into New River.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in S Pender County and flows N into Long Creek.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in S Pender County and flows SE into Rileys Creek.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in E Perquimans County and flows SW into Perquimans River. Known originally as Vosses Creek, named for William Voss, who owned land there before 1700. At the end of the nineteenth century, it was called Brights Mill Creek for a local mill owner. From that name the modern name derived.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in central Person County and flows NE into Maho Creek.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in W Person County and flows N into South Hyco Creek.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in central Randolph County and flows SE into Deep River. Appears on the MacRae map, 1833, and apparently named for Cox's Mill, which see, located at its junction with Deep River.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in SW Randolph County and flows NW into Uwharrie River.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in N Rutherford County and flows SE into Catheys Creek.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in W Sampson County and flows S into South River.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in W Surry County and flows SE into Mitchell River.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in N Swain County in Great Smoky Mountains National Park and flows SW into Noland Creek.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in S Transylvania County and flows NW into French Broad River.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises near Middle Mountain in S Transylvania County and flows N into Little River.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in N Union County and flows SE into Richardson Creek.

label: Mill Creek
description: former stream rising in E Vance County and flowing NW into Nutbush Creek; now covered by Kerr Lake.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in N Vance County and flows N into Virginia and Kerr Lake.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in NW Wake County and flows W into Big Lick Creek.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in W Wake County and flows N into Crabtree Creek.

label: Mill Creek
description: rises in S Wilkes County and flows N into Fishing Creek near its junction with Yadkin River. Formerly known as Little Fishing Creek.

label: Mill Creek
description: See Kendricks Creek.

label: Mill Fork
description: rises in N Caldwell County and flows SE into Yadkin River. Originally called South Fork of the Yadkin.

label: Mill Grove
description: country home of Carl Propst in W Cabarrus County. Originally home of Robert Harris, who ran a mill on nearby Rocky River. Later sold to Michael Cox and named Cox Mill.

label: Mill Knob
description: S Macon County between North Fork Coweeta Creek and Coweeta Creek.

label: Mill Mountain
description: E Haywood County between Big Branch and Crabtree Creek. Alt. 3,459.

label: Mill Point
description: NE Carteret County, extends into the mouth of Styron Bay.

label: Mill Point
description: extends from S Pasquotank County into Little River.

label: Mill Pond Creek
description: rises in central Henderson County and flows NW into French Broad River.

label: Mill Ridge
description: S Avery County.

label: Mill Run
description: rises in central Greene County and flows SE into Contentnea Creek. Early settlers built a gristmill and later a sawmill on the stream. Evidence of the old mill dam is still visible in the woods about 3 mi. upstream from its mouth in Contentnea Creek.

label: Mill Run
description: rises in central Jones County and flows NE into Trent River.

label: Mill Swamp
description: rises in SE Bertie County and flows NE into Roquist Creek.

label: Mill Swamp
description: rises in S Duplin County and flows S into Little Rockfish Creek.

label: Mill Swamp
description: rises in SE Sampson County and flows NE along the Duplin-Sampson County line and into Doctors Creek on the Duplin-Pender county line.

label: Mill Swamp
description: rises in NW Onslow County and flows SE into New River.

label: Mill Swamp
description: rises in NE Sampson County and flows SW into Six Runs Creek.

label: Miller Branch
description: rises in W Mitchell County and flows S into Brummett Creek.

label: Miller Cove
description: SE Buncombe County near the headwaters of Broad River.

label: Miller Gap
description: on the Ashe-Wilkes county line.

label: Miller Gap
description: central Avery County.

label: Miller Mountain
description: SE Buncombe County E of Little Pisgah Mountain.

label: Millers Creek
description: rises in E Caldwell County and flows E into the headwaters of Upper Little River. Formerly known as Bull Branch.

label: Millers Creek
description: rises in S Caldwell County and flows W into Lower Creek.

label: Millers Creek
description: rises in W Duplin County and flows W into Stewarts Creek.

label: Millers Creek
description: rises in W Surry County and flows SE into Mitchell River.

label: Millers Creek
description: rises in central Wilkes County and flows SE into Yadkin River.

label: Mills Creek
description: rises in SE Brunswick County and flows N into Prices Creek.

label: Mills River
description: is formed in NW Henderson County by the junction of South Fork and North Fork and flows NE into French Broad River. Inc. 2003.

label: Millstone Creek
description: rises in NE Franklin County and flows NE into Richland Creek.

label: Millstone Creek
description: rises in NW Wilson County and flows E approx. 5 mi. to join Juniper Creek in forming Bloomery Swamp. Named prior to 1783 for the fact that millstones were made from a type of stone found there.

label: Millstone Creek
description: See Austin Creek.

label: Millstone Mountain
description: E Haywood County between the head of Rice Cove Creek and Thickety Creek.

label: Millwood
description: community in central Chatham County served by post office, 1883-1914.

label: Milton
description: town in NE Caswell County on Dan River. Site settled by 1728; inc. 1796. Named for (a) Robert Milton, a Virginian who settled on the Dan River nearby; (b) Thomas Milton, who operated a mill where planters held community meetings; or (c) the mills operated in the community. Originally known as Thomas Mill, then as Mill Town until 1796. It was an important town in antebellum days, at one time having two newspapers, a branch of the State Bank, and considerable traffic on Dan River. Home to Thomas Day, free black craftsman.

label: Mine Branch
description: rises in W Haywood County and flows N into Jonathans Creek.

label: Mine Creek
description: rises in NW Alamance County and flows SE into Stony Creek.

label: Mine Creek
description: rises in E Mitchell County and flows NW into Cane Creek.

label: Mine Mountain
description: central Swain County between Peachtree Creek and Middle Peachtree Creek.

label: Mine Ridge
description: N Haywood County, extends S from Wildcat Spring to Skiffley Creek.

label: Mine Ridge
description: W Madison County between Grassy Creek and Shut-in Creek.

label: Mineral Springs Township
description: SW Moore County. Named for the spring at Jackson Springs.

label: Mirey Branch
description: rises in NE Hertford County and flows E into Chowan River.

label: Miry Branch
description: rises in NE Bladen County and flows E into South River.

label: Miry Branch
description: rises in S Johnston County and flows E into Neuse River. Mentioned in local records as early as 1795.

label: Mission
description: community in E Cherokee County near the mouth of Calhoun Creek.

label: Mitchell Branch
description: rises in NW Beaufort County and flows SW into Tranters Creek.

label: Mitchell Creek
description: rises in SE Craven County and flows NE into Clubfoot Creek.

label: Mitchell Creek
description: rises in N Person County and flows NW into Marlowe Creek.

label: Moccasin Creek
description: rises in N central Alleghany County and flows SE into Little River.

label: Moccasin Creek
description: rises in S Cherokee County and flows NW into Nottely River.

label: Moccasin Creek
description: rises in SW Franklin County and flows SE on the Franklin-Wake county line, the Johnston-Nash county line, and the Johnston -Wilson county line until it joins Turkey Creek in forming Contentnea Creek.

label: Moccasin Creek
description: rises in W Johnston County and flows SE into Neuse River.

label: Moccasin Gap
description: S Cherokee County at the SE end of Moccasin Mountain near the headwaters of Moccasin Creek.

label: Money Island
description: S central Carteret County near the E end of Bogue Banks in Bogue Sound.

label: Monroe
description: city and county seat, central Union County. Named for President James Monroe (1758-1831). Inc. 1844. Merged with town of Benton Heights, which see, in 1945 and with town of West Monroe, which see, in 1949. William Henry Belk opened the first of his department stores there in 1888. Produces textiles, apparel, bricks, processed meat, industrial machinery, fabricated metals, and wood products. Alt. 576.

label: Monroe Township
description: N central Guilford County.

label: Montford Point
description: Onslow County. Training site for black Marines in World War II. Adjunct to Cherry Point Marine Corps Air Station. See also Mount Pleasant Point.

label: Montgomery
description: community in SW Montgomery County served by post office, 1854-58.

label: Monticello
description: community in N Guilford County. Named for Thomas Jefferson's home near Charlottesville, Va. Formerly known as Lambeth for a boarding academy operated there by a minister named Lambeth.

label: Monticello
description: community in central Iredell County that grew up around a school of the same name est. there in the 1920s.

label: Montrose
description: community in central Chowan County.

label: Moody Branch
description: rises in N Buncombe County near Moody Gap and flows S into Poverty Branch.

label: Moody Branch
description: rises in NE Cherokee County and flows S into Webb Creek.

label: Moody Branch
description: rises in central Haywood County and flows NE into Cove Creek.

label: Moody Knob
description: on the Buncombe-Madison county line.

label: Moore Branch
description: rises in E Swain County and flows NE into Connelly Creek.

label: Moores Creek
description: rises in SE Brunswick County and flows E into Orton Creek.

label: Moores Creek
description: rises in W Guilford County and flows NE into Reedy Fork Creek.

label: Moores Creek
description: rises in NE Pender County and flows SW into Holly Shelter Creek.

label: Moores Crossroads
description: community in NE Johnston County.

label: Mooresville
description: town in S Iredell County near Lake Norman. Inc. 1873. Named for John F. Moore, first mayor and donor of land for railroad depot in 1857. Construction of the railroad began in 1860. Alt. 910. Produces apparel, textiles, and milling products.

label: Moravian Falls
description: S Wilkes County on Moravian Creek. Water falls from 30 to 35 ft. over broad, steep rock between wooded hills. Named because of its discovery by Moravian surveyors in 1752. Fishing, swimming, and picnicking.

label: Morehead Township
description: S Carteret County. Known for a time as township no. 2.

label: Morgan Branch
description: rises in E central Brunswick County and flows S into Town Creek.

label: Morgan Branch
description: rises in NE Buncombe County and flows SW into Right Fork.

label: Morgan Branch
description: rises in SW Buncombe County near Smathers Mountain and flows SE into South Hominy Creek.

label: Morgan Creek
description: rises in central Cherokee County and flows SE and SW into Valley River.

label: Morgan Creek
description: rises in SW Orange County and flows E into W Durham County, where it turns S into Chatham County and enters New Hope River. Formerly known as Mark Creek. Named for Mark Morgan, who owned land in the area as early as 1753.

label: Morgan Creek
description: rises in N Haywood County and flows SE into Fines Creek.

label: Morgan Township
description: SE Rowan County.

label: Morris Creek
description: rises in E Caldwell County and flows S into Cedar Creek.

label: Morrison
description: former community in W Iredell County on Fourth Creek near the present community of Loray. William Morrison (1704-71) settled there in 1750 and by 1752 was operating a gristmill. In an Indian attack, all buildings were burned except the mill, which was saved owing to an Indian superstition that evil would befall them if they burned a mill. Appears on the Collet map, 1770, and as Morrisons Mill as recently as 1901 on a map of the county. A cemetery with eighteenth-century tombstones marks the site.

label: Morrow Branch
description: rises in central Haywood County and flows SE into Jonathans Creek.

label: Moseley Creek
description: rises in Great Dover Swamp, W Craven County, and flows NW into Neuse River. For a part of its course, it forms the Craven-Lenoir county line.

label: Moses Branch
description: rises in E Macon County and flows NW into Elijay Creek.

label: Moses Knob
description: E Caldwell County. Probably named for Capt. Moses Guest, a Revolutionary soldier who lived nearby on the Yadkin River.

label: Moss
description: community in N Halifax County served by post office, 1897-1909.

label: Moss Branch
description: rises in central Anson County and flows E into Brush Fork Creek.

label: Moss Branch
description: rises in N Cherokee County on Hanging Dog Mountain and flows SE into Slickrock Branch.

label: Moss Branch
description: rises in central Clay County and flows S into Tusquitee Creek.

label: Mount Carmel
description: community in central Moore County served by post office, 1885-1905.

label: Mount Gilead
description: community in N Cabarrus County.

label: Mount Gilead Township
description: former township in N Cabarrus County, now township no. 5. In 1945 a part of the township was annexed to Concord.

label: Mount Hermon
description: unincorporated community in S central Alamance County. Name derived either from biblical Mount Hermon or for a local road known as Hermon Road for Regulator leader Hermon Husband. Mount Hermon Methodist Church, est. around 1829, is there.

label: Mount Mitchell
description: S Yancey County in Black Mountains. Alt. 6,684, the highest peak in E United States. Formerly known as Black Dome but renamed for Professor Elisha Mitchell (1793-1857) of the University of North Carolina, who fell to his death nearby while trying to verify his claim that it was the highest mountain E of the Mississippi. Known by the Cherokee Indians as Attakulla. See also Mitchell Falls.

label: Mount Olive
description: community in N Columbus County.

label: Mount Olive
description: community in S Stokes County; named for a church.

label: Mount Pisgah
description: community in NE Alexander County.

label: Mount Pisgah
description: on the Buncombe-Haywood county line NW of Little Pisgah Mountain. Alt. 5,721. Also sometimes known as Big Pisgah and Great Pisgah. View from its top includes points in North Carolina, South Carolina, Georgia, Tennessee, and Virginia. Reached by U.S. Forest Service trail from the Blue Ridge Parkway at Pisgah Inn. Named for the biblical mountain from which Moses saw the Promised Land. Known by the Indians as El-see-toss

label: Mount Pleasant
description: community in central Avery County.

label: Mount Pleasant
description: town in E Cabarrus County. Alt. 630. Settled about 1750 by Germans from Pennsylvania. Inc. 1859. Took its name from its elevated site between Buffalo Creek and Adams Creek. Former home of 2 Lutheran Synod church schools: Mount Pleasant Collegiate Institute (male) and Mount Amoena Seminary (female).

label: Mount Pleasant
description: community in SE Moore County between Crains Creek and Buffalo Creek.

label: Mount Pleasant
description: community in SW Nash County.

label: Mount Pleasant
description: community in W Rockingham County served by post office beginning in 1808. Named for plantation owned by Gov. Alexander Martin and his heirs, the Henderson family.

label: Mount Pleasant
description: community in N Yadkin County near the head of Forbush Creek.

label: Mount Sterling
description: W Haywood County in Great Smoky Mountains National Park near lat. 35°42'10" N., long. 83°07'20" W. Alt. 5,835. Said to have been named by a woodcutter and logger from the town of Sterling, Ky.

label: Mount Vernon
description: community in NW Rowan County on Fourth Creek. A post office as early as 1819 and as recent as 1882.

label: Mount Zion
description: community in W Wilkes County on Stony Fork Creek. Named for a Baptist church that was organized there in 1849.

label: Mountain Creek
description: rises in S Alexander County and flows S into Catawba River.

label: Mountain Creek
description: is formed by the junction of its North and South Forks in SE Catawba County. It flows SE into Catawba River.

label: Mountain Creek
description: rises in NW Durham County and flows SE into Little River.

label: Mountain Creek
description: rises in central Graham County and flows SW into Santeetlah Lake.

label: Mountain Creek
description: rises in N Granville County and flows NE into Grassy Creek.

label: Mountain Creek
description: rises in W Hoke County and flows SW into Lumber River.

label: Mountain Creek
description: rises in S Orange County and flows NE into New Hope Creek.

label: Mountain Creek
description: rises in N Rutherford County and flows S into Broad River. Fort McFadden was located on the creek near the present site of Rutherfordton in the mid-eighteenth century.

label: Mountain Creek
description: rises in N Stanly County and flows SE into Pee Dee River.

label: Mud Creek
description: rises in SW Durham County and flows SE into New Hope Creek. Formerly known as Bakers Creek.

label: Mud Creek
description: rises in W Gates County and flows SE into Chowan River.

label: Mud Creek
description: rises in SW Henderson County and flows NE and NW into French Broad River. The Indian name was Oklawaha (Muddy Waters). See also Naples.

label: Muddy Creek
description: rises in SE Beaufort County and flows NW into Bond Creek.

label: Muddy Creek
description: rises in the S tip of Cabarrus County and flows SE into Rocky River.

label: Muddy Creek
description: rises in central Catawba County and flows SE and SW into Henry Fork.

label: Muddy Creek
description: rises in E Duplin County and flows SW into Northeast Cape Fear River.

label: Muddy Creek
description: rises in NW Forsyth County and flows S into Davidson County, where it enters Yadkin River. Called Charles Creek on the Collet map, 1770.

label: Muddy Creek
description: rises in S Onslow County and flows SE into Stones Bay.

label: Muddy Creek
description: rises in NW Randolph County and flows SE into Deep River. Appears on the Collet map, 1770.

label: Muddy Creek
description: rises in N Scotland County and flows NE into Lumber River.

label: Muddy Creek
description: rises in SW Stokes County and flows S through W Forsyth County and into NW Davidson County, where it enters Yadkin River. Appears as Gargals Creek on the Fry-Jefferson map, 1755, and as Gargales Creek on the Collet map, 1770. The uppermost branch is shown on the Collet map as Dorithea Creek, named for Dorothea, Countess Zinzendorf, whose husband was a patron of the Moravians. Known as Dorithea Creek as early as 1756, but sometime after 1770 its entire course became known as Muddy Creek.

label: Mulberry Creek
description: is formed in SE Ashe County by the junction of Meadow Fork and Laurel Fork Creeks and flows N and W to join Piney Fork Creek in forming Cranberry Creek.

label: Mulberry Creek
description: rises in N Caldwell County about 2½ mi. SE of Blowing Rock in Pisgah National Forest and flows approx. 12 mi. S into Johns River.

label: Mulberry Creek
description: rises in N central Carteret County and flows S into South River.

label: Mulberry Creek
description: rises in S Macon County and flows SE into Little Tennessee River.

label: Mulberry Gap
description: on the Alleghany-Wilkes county line.

label: Murphy Branch
description: rises in S Mitchell County and flows W into Crabtree Creek.

label: Murray Branch
description: rises in E Haywood County in Buckeye Cove and flows S into Pigeon River.

label: Murray Branch
description: rises in NW Henderson County and flows S into Boylston Creek.

label: Murray Gap
description: W Haywood County between Huckleberry Knob and Winding Knob.

label: Myers
description: community in N Wilkes County near Middle Prong Roaring River.

label: Myrtle
description: community in central Rutherford County served by post office, 1885-1907.

label: Nahunta
description: community in NW Wayne County S of Nahunta Creek, from which it takes its name. Called Academy Crossroads as recently as 1915.

label: Naked Creek
description: rises in central Ashe County and flows E into South Fork New River.

label: Naked Creek
description: rises in N Catawba County and flows N into Catawba River.

label: Nantahala Township
description: NW Macon County.

label: Narrows, The
description: the final mile and a half of Newport River confined within banks before it approaches the estuary, central Carteret County.

label: Narrows, The
description: section of Green River in E Henderson County where rocks narrow to tight passageway. Favored by kayakers despite access difficulties.

label: Nathans Creek
description: rises in E Ashe County and flows E into South Fork New River.

label: Neal Branch
description: rises in SW Mecklenburg County and flows NW into Stowe Branch.

label: Nebo
description: community in E McDowell County. Inc. 1909; charter repealed 1943. Alt. 1,282. A popular Methodist campground there before the Civil War was known as Nebo for the biblical mountain. When the North Carolina Railroad was constructed, the station there took the name of the campground.

label: Needmore
description: community in S Caldwell County between Lower and Smoky Creeks.

label: Needmore
description: community in NW Franklin County. Also known as Wilder.

label: Needmore
description: community in Moore County N of Carthage. Settled by African Americans after the Civil War.

label: Needmore
description: community in NW Rowan County.

label: Nelson
description: community in central Caldwell County.

label: Nelson Branch
description: rises in central Haywood County and flows NE into Jonathans Creek.

label: Nelson Branch
description: rises in N Haywood County and flows SE into Whiteoak Branch.

label: Nelson Branch
description: rises in W Haywood County and flows NE into Cataloochee Creek.

label: Nettle Knob
description: in central Watauga County N of Howard Creek. Alt. 4,000.

label: New Hope
description: community in S Franklin County.

label: New Hope
description: community in NW Iredell County.

label: New Hope
description: community in E Wayne County. A post office was located there by 1811.

label: New Hope
description: community in NW Wilson County S of Silver Lake. Named for a local Baptist church.

label: New Hope Township
description: E Chatham County.

label: New Hope Township
description: NW Iredell County. Named for a Civil War muster ground.

label: New Hope Township
description: SE Perquimans County.

label: New Inlet
description: from the Atlantic Ocean into Pamlico Sound S of Pea Island, SE Dare County. It opened probably in the late 1720s and has closed periodically, the most recent closing being in the 1930s. Also known as Chickinacommock and as such appears on the Moll map, 1729.

label: New Lands
description: community in W Tyrrell County E of White Oak Island.

label: New River
description: is formed on the Ashe-Alleghany county line by the junction of North Fork and South Fork New River. It flows NE and NW into Virginia and West Virginia and enters Kanawha River at Charleston, W.Va. In its meanderings, it crosses the North Carolina-Virginia line into Alleghany County several times. Named because of the discovery of the river in 1749, when the boundary between North Carolina and Virginia was extended 90 mi. The surveyors crossed what they thought was "a large branch of the Mississippi which runs between the ledges of the mountains," and which, in the words of Governor Gabriel Johnston, "Nobody ever drempt of before." Designated a National Scenic River in 1976; now a state park.

label: New Salem
description: community in N Randolph County served by post office, 1879-1906.

label: New Salem
description: community in NE Union County. Named for a local school by the State Highway Commission when it took over maintenance of local roads and a name was entered on a road map of the county. The crossroads community there was originally called Euto by returning veterans of the Battle of Eutaw Springs, S.C., during the Revolution. Served by post office, 1880-1905.

label: New Town
description: See Charles Town.

label: New Town
description: See Farmville.

label: New Town
description: See Swansboro.

label: New Town
description: See Wadesboro.

label: Newfound Gap
description: on the Buncombe-Haywood county line at the S end of Newfound Mountain. Alt. approx. 3,000.

label: Newfoundland
description: community in N Tyrrell County at the head of Alligator Creek. Former post office, Gudger, operated there, 1882-1912.

label: Newport
description: town in W Carteret County on Newport River. Inc. 1866. Alt. 20 ft. First known as Bells Corners, but Quakers from Rhode Island settled there and changed the name to Newport for the city in their native state.

label: Newton
description: city and county seat, in central Catawba County. Alt. 996. Authorized to be laid out in 1845, inc. 1855. Named for Isaac Newton Wilson, son of Nathaniel Wilson and member of the General Assembly in 1842. He introduced the bill to create Catawba County. Produces textiles, furniture, hosiery, apparel, and paper boxes.

label: Nicks Creek
description: rises in S McDowell County and flows NE into Catawba River.

label: Nicks Creek
description: rises in W Moore County and flows NE into Little River. Named for Nicholas Smith, who settled there about 1768.

label: Nobles Mill Pond
description: on tributary of Cokey Swamp in central Edgecombe County. Est. by Nobles family for furnishing waterpower for mill. Has max. depth of 15 ft. and area of 37 acres. Now used for fishing, swimming, and boating. Open to the public.

label: Noland Creek
description: rises in E Davie County and flows approx. 1½ mi. SW into Dutchmans Creek.

label: Norris Branch
description: rises in W Wake County and flows SW into Cary Branch.

label: North Bay
description: in the N end of Cedar Island in NE Carteret County adjacent to West Bay.

label: North Fork
description: rises in S Clay County and flows E into Blair Creek.

label: North Fork
description: rises in central Forsyth County and flows SW into Muddy Creek.

label: North Fork
description: rises in S Haywood County and flows SE into Shining Creek.

label: North Fork
description: is formed in NW Henderson County by the junction of Big and Fletcher Creeks. It flows SE to join South Fork in forming Mills River. Sometimes also known as North Fork Mills River.

label: North Fork
description: rises in W Henderson County and flows W into Willow Creek.

label: North Fork
description: rises in S Jones County and flows SE into White Oak River.

label: North Fork
description: rises in NE Madison County and flows S into Big Laurel Creek.

label: North Fork
description: community in N Watauga County on North Fork [Cove Creek].

label: North Fork Township
description: SW Ashe County.

label: North River
description: rises in Dismal Swamp, E Camden County and flows S approx. 18 mi. into Albemarle Sound. For a part of its course, it forms the boundary between Camden and Currituck Counties. Above Thoroughfare Island it is sometimes known as Indiantown Creek. Shown as Potaskike River on the Comberford map, 1657, but as North River on the Ogilby map, 1671, and subsequent maps.

label: Northeast
description: community in NE Onslow County.

label: Northeast Creek
description: rises in SW Durham County and flows SW into Chatham County, where it enters New Hope River.

label: Norton
description: community on Grassy Camp Creek and Norton Creek in SW Jackson County. Named for pioneer settler Roderick Norton. His son Richard was first postmaster.

label: Norton Branch
description: rises in S Macon County near Downs Mountain and flows NE into Little Tennessee River.

label: Norton Branch
description: rises in S Macon County near Plass Gap and flows W into Little Tennessee River.

label: Oak Grove
description: community in SW Brunswick County.

label: Oak Grove
description: community in central Davie County between Elisha and Dutchmans Creeks. Est. prior to 1879. Also known as Maine.

label: Oak Grove
description: community on Little Lick Creek in E Durham County.

label: Oak Grove
description: community in S Jones County.

label: Oak Grove
description: community in N Macon County between Caler Cove Branch and Lakey Creek.

label: Oak Grove
description: community in NW Northampton County. The post office there, 1907-26, was known as Stancell.

label: Oak Grove
description: community in N Surry County between Wood Fork Branch and Little Fisher River.

label: Oak Hill
description: community in E Caldwell County.

label: Oak Hill

label: Oak Knob

label: Oak Park

label: Oak Ridge

label: Oak Ridge

label: Oakdale

label: Oakgrove

label: Oakland

label: Oakley

label: Old Field Creek
description: rises in N Caldwell County and flows NE into Buffalo Creek.

label: Old Topsail Inlet
description: S Pender County, through which waters of Topsail Sound enter the Atlantic Ocean. It lies between New Topsail Inlet on the N and Rich Inlet on the s.

label: Oldfield Gap
description: N Graham County between Yellow Creek Mountains and Fork Ridge.

label: Olive Hill
description: community in central Macon County on Iotla Creek.

label: Orchard Branch
description: rises in E Haywood County and flows SE into Fines Creek.

label: Orchard Creek

label: Ore Knob

label: Orton

label: Osceola

label: Otter Creek
description: rises in E Alamance County and flows S into Quaker Scrub Creek.

label: Otter Creek
description: rises in E Craven County and flows N into Neuse River.

label: Otter Creek
description: rises in NW Macon County and flows SW into Whiteoak Creek.

label: Otter Creek
description: rises in E Wilson County and flows E across S Edgecombe County into W Pitt County, where it enters Tar River.

label: Otter Creek

label: Oyster Creek

label: Oyster Creek

label: Paint Fork

label: Paint Fork

label: Paint Fork
description: rises in E Madison County and flows SE to join California Creek in forming Little Ivy Creek.

label: Paint Gap

label: Paint Gap

label: Painter Branch
description: rises in E Cherokee County and flows NW into Peachtree Creek.

label: Painter Branch

description: rises in W Lenoir County and flows N into Dailys Creek.

description: rises in E Pitt County and flows SE into Tar River.

label: Persimmon Creek
description: rises in SW Cherokee County and flows NE into Hiwassee River. A fixed level impoundment of Persimmon Creek covers an area of 100 acres and overflows into Hiwassee Lake. It is maintained by the U.S. Forest Service.

label: Persimmon Creek
description: rises in central Lee County and flows N into Big Buffalo Creek.

label: Peters Creek

label: Peterson

label: Phillips Knob

label: Pierce Creek
description: rises in NW Macon County and flows NE into Nantahala River.

label: Pigeon Creek
description: rises in NE Swain County and flows NW into Raven Fork.

label: Pigeon Gap
description: S Haywood County on the head of Bird Creek.

label: Pigeonroost Creek
description: rises in NW Mitchell County and flows SW into Toe River.

label: Pike
description: community in S Cumberland County served by post office, 1877-1901.

label: Pilot Knob
description: on Avery-Caldwell county line.

label: Pilot Knob
description: S Madison County at the head of Bailey Branch.

label: Pilot Mountain
description: on Burke-McDowell county line. Alt. 2,050.

label: Pilot Mountain
description: SE Caldwell County. Alt. 1,486.

label: Pilot Mountain
description: on Lewis Creek in E Henderson County. Alt. 2,608.

label: Pilot Mountain
description: in central Jackson County between Shoal Creek and Betsy Branch. Alt. 4,059.

label: Pilot Mountain
description: E Randolph County.

label: Pilot Mountain
description: SE Surry County. Alt. 2,700. The mountain is an isolated peak surviving from ancient mountains that have eroded away. The peak, classified as a monadnock, stands 1,500 ft. above the surrounding countryside; it served as a landmark for Indians and pioneer white settlers of the area. Appears as "Mt. Ararat or the Stonehead" on the Fry-Jefferson map, 1753, and as Mt. Ararat on the Collet map, 1770. The Price map, 1808, and subsequent maps show it with the present name. Called Jomeokee by the Indians, meaning "The Great Guide." The Devil's Den on Pilot Mountain is a small grotto from which a steady breeze blows at all times. See also Brushy Mountains.

label: Pilot Mountain
description: W Transylvania County S of Deep Gap. Alt. 5,151.

label: Pilot Mountain
description: S Wilkes County S of Hunting Creek.

label: Pin Hook
description: community in SE Duplin County.

label: Pinch Gut Creek
description: rises in E central Brunswick County and flows S to join Red Run in forming Lockwoods Folly River.

label: Pine Branch
description: rises in central Avery County and flows N into Plumtree Creek.

label: Pine Branch
description: rises in W Macon County and flows NE into Dicks Creek.

label: Pine Branch
description: rises in E Mitchell County and flows SW into North Toe River.

label: Pine Branch
description: rises in N Mitchell County and flows SW into Right Fork Bean Creek.

label: Pine Knob
description: on the Avery-Mitchell county line.

label: Pine Knob
description: central Buncombe County between Rocky Knob and Jack Gap.

label: Pine Knob
description: N Cherokee County.

label: Pine Knob
description: SE Clay County at N end of Sharptop Ridge. Alt. approx. 3,650.

label: Pine Knob

label: Pine Knob

label: Pine Knob
description: S Macon County between Plass Gap and High Top.

label: Pine Knob

label: Pine Mountain

label: Pine Mountain

label: Pine Mountain

label: Pine Mountain

label: Pine Mountain
description: S Mitchell County between Brushy Creek and North Toe River.

label: Pine Mountain

label: Pine Mountain

label: Pine Ridge

label: Pine Ridge

label: Pine Ridge
description: W Graham County between Cold Branch and Johns Branch.

label: Pine Ridge
description: along the N bank of the Tuckasegee River opposite Barkers Creek community in W Jackson County.

label: Pine Ridge

label: Pine Ridge
description: S Macon County between South Fork [Skeenah Creek] and North Fork [Skeenah Creek].

label: Pine Ridge

label: Piney Grove

label: Piney Mountain

label: Piney Mountain
description: SW Buncombe County S of Peggy Peak.

label: Poplar Branch

label: Poplar Branch
description: rises in S Lee County and flows S into Little River.

label: Poplar Branch
description: rises in N Rockingham County and flows SW into Matrimony Creek.

label: Poplar Branch
description: rises in E central Wilson County and flows S into Whiteoak Swamp.

label: Poplar Branch
description: rises in SW Wilson County and flows NE into Black Creek.

label: Porter Cove

label: Potato Hill

label: Potato Hill

label: Potato Knob

label: Potato Knob
description: on the Buncombe-Yancey county line between Rainbow Gap and Swannanoa Gap. Alt. approx. 6,400, the highest point in Buncombe County. Known earlier as Potato Top.

label: Potts Creek
description: rises in SE Cleveland County and flows NW into Buffalo Creek.

label: Potts Creek
description: rises in central Macon County and flows NE into Cartoogechaye Creek.

label: Pounding Mill Branch
description: rises in N Cherokee County in the Snowbird Mountains and flows SE into Hyatt Creek.

label: Pounding Mill Branch
description: rises in N Haywood County and flows SE into Cold Springs Creek.

label: Pounding Mill Branch
description: rises in N Madison County and flows SW into Little Laurel Creek.

label: Pounding Mill Branch
description: rises in N Transylvania County near Green Knob and flows SE into Looking Glass Creek.

label: Pounding Mill Branch

label: Powell Creek
description: rises in S Buncombe County and flows W into French Broad River. Skyland Lake, which see, is on the stream.

label: Powell Creek
description: rises in Virginia and flows SW into Northampton County, where it enters Meherrin River.

label: Powells Creek
description: rises in W Halifax County and flows SE into Little Fishing Creek.

label: Powelltown
description: community on the outskirts of Lenoir, central Caldwell County. Named for a British soldier, Elias Powell (d. 1831), who remained in the area following the Battle of Kings Mountain, 1780. Known earlier as Powellton.

label: Price Creek
description: rises in SE Brunswick County and flows E into the Cape Fear River.

label: Price Creek
description: rises in S Orange County and flows NE into Neville Creek.

label: Princeton

label: Prospect

label: Prospect Ridge

label: Providence
description: community in NW Caswell County, sometimes known locally as "Hell's Half Acre." Post office est. there, 1953.

label: Providence
description: community in central Granville County. A former post office there, 1890-1922, was known as Hargrove. Alt. 431.

label: Providence
description: community in S McDowell County on the head of Nicks Creek.

label: Providence Township
description: former township in S Mecklenburg County, now township no. 5.

label: Providence Township
description: NE Pasquotank County.

label: Providence Township
description: NE Randolph County.

label: Pump Branch
description: rises in N Madison County and flows SE into French Broad River.

label: Queen Creek
description: rises in S Haywood County and flows E into West Fork Pigeon River.

label: Queens Creek

label: Raccoon Branch
description: rises in W Madison County and flows NE into French Broad River.

label: Raccoon Creek
description: rises in W Lee County and flows NW into Pocket Creek.

label: Raccoon Creek
description: rises in W Mitchell County and flows SW into Toe River.

label: Raccoon Creek
description: rises in N Pamlico County and flows SE into Bay River.

label: Raccoon Creek
description: rises in SW Perquimans County in Bear Swamp and flows NE into Perquimans River. Until early in the twentieth century, it was known as Skinners Creek. In colonial days it was known as Castletons Creek (for George Castleton, a landowner there prior to 1688). Two small streams, now without names, that form the headwaters of Raccoon Creek were known in the seventeenth and eighteenth centuries as Lakers Creek (for Benjamin Laker, who owned land there in 1686) and Perrishoes Creek (for James Perishoe, who lived on the creek prior to 1688). Lakers Creek appears on the Moseley map, 1733.

label: Raccoon Swamp
description: rises in SE Bladen County and flows W into Colly Creek.

label: Rainbow Gap
description: NE Buncombe County between Lookout Mountain and Montreat. Alt. approx. 3,250.

label: Ramsey Creek
description: rises in S Iredell County and flows W into Catawba River.

label: Rattlesnake Branch

label: Rattlesnake Branch
description: rises in SE Brunswick County and flows SW into River Swamp.

label: Rattlesnake Branch

label: Rattlesnake Branch
description: rises in E Macon County and flows NW into Brush Creek.

label: Reba

label: Red Hill

label: Red Hill

label: Red Hill

A Redbanks Church near the creek has been in existence since 1859.

label: Reed Creek

label: Reed Creek

label: Reed Creek
description: rises in S Randolph County and flows SE into Little River.

label: Reedy Branch

label: Reedy Branch
description: rises in NE Caldwell County and flows N into Yadkin River.

label: Reedy Creek

See also Lane Pinnacle.

label: Reynolds Gap

label: Rich Knob

label: Rich Knob

label: Rich Knob

label: Rich Mountain

label: Rich Mountain

label: Rich Mountain

label: Rich Mountain
description: N Henderson County between Couch Mountain and Baldwin Gap.

label: Rich Mountain
description: on the Henderson-Polk county line. Alt. 2,542.

label: Rich Mountain
description: in NW Jackson County between Dicks Creek and Camp Creek.

label: Rich Mountain

label: Rich Mountain

label: Rich Mountain

label: Rich Mountain

label: Rich Mountain

label: Rich Mountain

label: Rich Mountain

label: Rich Mountain

label: Rich Mountain Bald

label: Rich Mountain Gap

label: Richland Creek

label: Richland Creek

label: Richland Creek

label: Riley Knob

label: River Township

label: River Township

label: Riverside

label: Roanoke

label: Roanoke Township

label: Roaring Creek

label: Roaring Creek

label: Roaring Fork

label: Roaring Fork

label: Roaring Fork

label: Robin Branch

label: Robinson Creek

label: Robinson Creek

label: Robinson Point

label: Rock Branch

label: Rock Branch
description: rises in S Macon County and flows SW into Betty Creek.

label: Rock Camp Branch

label: Rock Creek

label: Rock Creek

label: Rock Creek

label: Rock Creek
description: rises in S Burke County and flows SE into Catawba County, where it enters Jacob Fork.

label: Rock Creek
description: rises in central Graham County and flows NE into Atoah Creek.

label: Rock Creek
description: rises in E Graham County and flows NE into Panther Creek.

label: Rock Creek

label: Rock House Creek

label: Rockfish

label: Rockfish Creek

label: Rockfish Township

label: Rockhouse Creek

label: Rockhouse Creek

label: Rockhouse Creek

label: Rocky Branch

label: Rocky Branch
description: rises in N Wake County and flows SW into Neuse River.

label: Rocky Cove
description: S Buncombe County.

label: Rocky Cove
description: E Haywood County on Hominy Creek.

label: Rocky Cove
description: SE Haywood County on East Prong Pigeon River.

label: Rocky Cove
description: SW Macon County on a tributary of Poplar Cove Creek.

label: Rocky Creek
description: rises in S Granville County and flows E into Tar River.

label: Rocky Creek
description: rises in S Transylvania County and flows SW into Toxaway River.

label: Rocky Creek
description: rises in W Warren County and flows SE into Fishing Creek.

label: Rocky Creek
description: rises in S Wilkes County and flows NE into Hunting Creek N of Pilot Mountain. Approx. 4 mi. long.

label: Rocky Creek

label: Rocky Knob

label: Rocky Knob

label: Rocky Knob

label: Rocky Knob

label: Rocky Knob

label: Rocky Knob

label: Rocky Knob

label: Rocky Knob

label: Rocky Knob

label: Rocky Knob

label: Rocky Knob
description: on the Jackson-Transylvania county line N of Pinhook Gap. Part of Tennessee Ridge, which see. Alt. approx. 4,000.

label: Rocky Knob

label: Rocky Knob

label: Rocky Knob

label: Rocky Knob

label: Rocky Knob Ridge

label: Rocky Mount Township

label: Rocky Mountain

label: Rockyface Mountain

label: Rogers Cove
description: central Haywood County on a tributary of Richland Creek.

label: Rogers Gap
description: NW Buncombe County in Fodderstack Mountain near Greasy Cove.

label: Rollins
description: community in S Burke County served by post office, 1881-1905.

label: Rose
description: community in N Chatham County served by post office, 1892-1904.

label: Rose Bay
description: in Pamlico Sound W of Bell Island in S Hyde County. See also Cecils Harbor.

label: Rose Branch
description: rises in central Mitchell County near Burns Mountain and flows W into North Toe River.

label: Rose Creek
description: rises in NW Burke County on Rose Mountain and flows SE into Irish Creek. Named for pioneer Rose family.

label: Rose Creek
description: rises in SE Mitchell County and flows S and NW into North Toe River.

label: Rosebud
description: community in SE Stokes County.

label: Roses Branch
description: rises in central Mitchell County and flows W into Toe River.

label: Roses Branch
description: rises in NE Yancey County and flows NE into Toe River.

label: Roses Creek
description: rises in NW Burke County and flows SE into Irish Creek.

label: Rough Fork
description: W Haywood County in Great Smoky Mountains National Park, is formed by the junction of Bear Branch and Horse Creek near lat. 35°36'10" N., long. 83°09'43" W., and flows NE into Palmer Creek.

label: Rough Knob
description: on the Haywood-Madison county line.

label: Rough Ridge
description: E Avery County.

label: Round Knob
description: SW McDowell County. Alt. approx. 3,500. The Southern Railway winds around the mountain.

label: Round Mountain
description: on the Buncombe-Haywood county line SE of Twelve O'clock Top.

label: Round Mountain
description: N Cherokee County in the Unicoi Mountains.

label: Round Mountain
description: SE corner of Jackson County between East Fork [Chattooga River] and Whitewater River. Alt. approx. 3,700.

label: Round Mountain
description: E Macon County between Deep Gap and Brush Creek.

label: Round Mountain
description: NE Mitchell County between Charles Creek and Roan Valley.

label: Round Mountain
description: SW Polk County E of Tryon. Site of Battle of Round Mountain between Rangers from both Carolinas under Capt. Thomas Howard and Cherokee Indians under Big Wayah in the spring of 1776. Alt. 1,831. See also Skyuka Creek; Skyuka Mountain.

label: Round Mountain
description: a ridge in NW Swain County in Great Smoky Mountains National Park. It is a spur extending SE in an arc from Twentymile Ridge to Lost Creek, with its center near lat. 35°30'57" N., long. 83°47'20" W.

label: Round Mountain
description: on the Jackson-Transylvania county line N of the head of West Fork French Broad River and approx. 1½ mi. E of Tuckasegee River. Alt. approx. 4,220. Southernmost peak of Tennessee Ridge, which see.

label: Round Mountain
description: community in central Wilkes County served by post office, 1884-1943.

label: Round Mountain
description: E central Wilkes County between Camp Branch and the head of Rock Creek.

label: Round Top
description: mountain in NE Alexander County; an almost perfect cone. Alt. 1,750.

label: Round Top
description: on the Cherokee County, N.C.-Monroe County, Tenn., line. Alt. approx. 3,700.

label: Round Top
description: W Cherokee County W of Shoal Creek. Alt. approx. 2,130.

label: Round Top
description: on the Buncombe-Henderson county line.

label: Round Top Mountain
description: central Chatham County.

label: Round Top Mountain
description: SE Clay County N of Sharptop Ridge near the Towns County, Ga., line. Alt. approx. 3,560.

label: Rowan Branch
description: rises in E Sampson County and flows E into Six Runs Creek.

label: Royal
description: community in SE Beaufort County est. 1908 and known first as Dublin for the city in Ireland. Renamed for George E. Royal, a railroad official.

label: Runyon Creek
description: is formed by the junction of several small unnamed streams NE of Washington, W Beaufort County, and flows S into Pamlico River.

label: Rush Branch
description: rises in NE Buncombe County and flows SE into Broad River.

label: Rush Branch
description: rises in NW Henderson County and flows NE into North Fork Mills River.

label: Rush Mountain
description: S Henderson County between Huckleberry Ridge and McAlpine Mountain.

label: Russell
description: community in SW Chatham County.

label: Russell Gap
description: on the Alexander-Wilkes county line. Alt. 1,550.

label: Russells Creek
description: rises in E central Brunswick County and flows E and N into Town Creek.

label: Ruth
description: community in N Forsyth County served by post office, 1885-1903.

label: Salem
description: community in SE Burke County.

label: Salem
description: formerly an independent city in central Forsyth County; inc. 1856, but since 1913 consolidated with Winston as Winston-Salem, which see. Salem was laid out and settled in 1766 by Moravians; its name, meaning "peace," is said to have been selected by Count Nikolaus Zinzendorf, patron and leader of the Moravian Church, prior to his death in 1760. Records of the Moravians from 1752 to 1876 have been published in 10 volumes. Old Salem has been largely restored as a living history museum, with shops, homes, a tavern (where George Washington was entertained in 1791), and other buildings open to the public.

label: Salem
description: community in S Lincoln County.

label: Salem
description: community in N Randolph County. Authorized to be laid off as New Salem, 1818; inc. 1831, but long inactive in municipal affairs. Came to be known as Salem after 1882. Long the site of a popular camp meeting in the summer.

label: Salem Creek
description: rises in E Forsyth County and flows SW through the city of Winston-Salem into Muddy Creek in the SW corner of the county. Appears as Wack Creek on the Collet map, 1770; as "Middle Watch Creek" on the Price map, 1808; and finally as Middle Fork on the MacRae map, 1833. Known as Middle Fork or Middle Fork Muddy Creek until 1966, when the present name was adopted. Wack and Watch undoubtedly are derived from the name Wachovia, which see.

label: Salem Township
description: E central Granville County.

label: Sally Branch
description: rises in E Franklin County and flows N into Lick Meadow Branch.

label: Salmon Creek
description: rises in E Bertie County and flows SE into Chowan River. Appears as Flatt's Creek on the Comberford map, 1657, but as Salmon Creek on the Ogilby map, 1671. Probably named for an early settler. Area known as "Seedbed of the Colony" due to residence of early settlers, such as Nathaniel Batts, and leaders, such as Charles Eden, royal governor.

label: Saltrock Branch
description: rises in NE Buncombe County and flows SE into North Fork [Swannanoa River].

label: Sam Branch
description: rises in central Cherokee County and flows NW into Valley River.

label: Sam Branch
description: rises in S Haywood County and flows NW into West Fork Pigeon River.

label: Sampson Gap
description: NE Transylvania County NE of Sharpy Mountain near the Haywood County line.

label: Sams Branch
description: rises in SW Buncombe County near Twelve O'clock Top and flows W into South Hominy Creek.

label: Sams Branch
description: rises in W Mitchell County and flows SW into Nolichucky River.

label: Sams Gap
description: on the Madison County, N.C.-Unicoi County, Tenn., line.

label: Sanders Creek
description: a tidal inlet on the N side of Bogue Sound approx. 2 mi. W of Broad Creek, W Carteret County. It is formed by the junction of Sikes Branch and East Prong.

label: Sanders Creek
description: rises in W Carteret County and flows S into Goose Creek. Appears as Smiths Creek on the Moseley map, 1733.

label: Sanders Knob
description: on McDowell Branch in central Macon County.

label: Sandy Bottom
description: a sandy strip approx. ½ mi. long along the W bank of French Broad River in S Buncombe County between Bent Creek and Orton Branch.

label: Sandy Bottom
description: community in W Lenoir County. The site is mentioned by name in local records beginning in the 1760s. In December 1862 invading Union forces gave the more sophisticated name Sandy Foundation to the community, and a post office there bore the name, 1847-82. Also known as Sandy Ridge during the Civil War.

label: Sandy Branch
description: rises in E Mitchell County and flows SE into Cane Creek.

label: Sandy Creek
description: rises near Buckingham Mountain in SW Alamance County and flows N into Rock Creek.

label: Sandy Creek
description: rises in E Cumberland County and flows E into South River.

label: Sandy Creek
description: rises in W Davidson County and flows NW into Hartleys Creek.

label: Sandy Creek
description: rises in central Granville County and flows SE into Redbud Creek in Nash County.

label: Sandy Creek
description: rises in NE Randolph County and flows SW into Deep River.

label: Sandy Creek
description: rises in SE Vance County and flows SE across Warren and Franklin Counties and into Nash County, where, in Hilliardston community, the name is changed to Swift Creek, which see.

label: Sandy Creek Township
description: former township in N Franklin County, now township no. 6.

label: Sandy Creek Township
description: SE Vance County.

label: Sandy Cross
description: crossroads community in S Nash County. Named because of sandy soil in the vicinity.

label: Sandy Gap
description: central Cherokee County between West Prong Grape Creek and Rose Creek.

label: Sandy Gap
description: NE Cherokee County in the Snowbird Mountains.

label: Sandy Gap
description: NW Cherokee County in the Unicoi Mountains.

label: Sandy Gap
description: SW Cherokee County near the headwaters of Buck Creek.

label: Sandy Gap
description: on the McDowell-Mitchell county line.

label: Sandy Mush
description: community in NW Buncombe County near the junction of Clark Branch and Sandy Mush Creek. Took its name from the creek.

label: Sandy Mush Township
description: W Buncombe County.

label: Sandy Point
description: extends from the N mainland of Carteret County into Neuse River.

label: Sandy Point
description: point of S Chowan County extending into Albemarle Sound. Appears on the Hack map, 1684, and the Moseley map, 1733.

label: Sandy Point
description: extends from the mainland of S Dare County into Pamlico Sound. It separates Sandy Bay on the S from Stumpy Point Bay on the n. Appears on the Moseley map, 1733.

label: Sandy Point
description: extends E from the mainland of NE Tyrrell County into Alligator River. Shown on the Price map, 1808. State-operated ferry from the point to East Lake Landing in NW Dare County replaced by the Lindsay C. Warren Bridge, 2.83 mi. long and opened in May 1962; named for Lindsay C. Warren (1889-1976), U.S. congressman and comptroller general.

label: Sandy Ridge
description: community in N Stokes County near Buffalo Creek.

label: Sandy Run
description: rises in NE Duplin County and flows SE on the Duplin-Wayne county line until it enters Northeast Cape Fear River.

label: Sandy Run
description: rises in N Greene County and flows SE into Middle Swamp. Appears on the Collet map, 1770. Known as Horn Swamp until some time between 1760 and 1767.

label: Sandy Run
description: rises in S Moore County and flows SW into Deep Creek.

label: Sandy Run Creek
description: rises in central Burke County and flows N into Hunting Creek.

label: Sardis
description: community in S Mecklenburg County. Sardis Presbyterian Church was organized there in 1790.

label: Sassafras Branch
description: rises in central Cherokee County and flows SE into Colvard Creek.

label: Sassafras Branch
description: rises in SE Clay County and flows SE into Tallulah River.

label: Sassafras Gap
description: central Buncombe County E of Buzzard Rock.

label: Sassafras Gap
description: in E Jackson County on Old Bald Ridge.

label: Sassafras Gap
description: on the Jackson-Macon County line. Alt. approx. 4,100.

label: Sassafras Gap
description: NW Swain County on Twentymile Ridge in Great Smoky Mountains National Park near lat. 35°29'22" N., long. 83°48'55" W. Alt. approx. 3,650.

label: Sassafras Gap
description: on the Graham-Swain county line between Cheoah Bald and Swim Bald in Nantahala National Forest. Alt. approx. 4,380.

label: Sassafras Gap
description: on Laurel Mountain W of Johnson Knob in NW Henderson County near the Transylvania County line. Alt. approx. 4,060.

label: Sassafras Knob
description: on the Cherokee-Clay County line in the Valley River Mountains.

label: Sassafras Knob
description: E Haywood County on the N end of Sassafras Ridge.

label: Sassafras Knob
description: SE Macon County between Brushy Face and Monger Creek.

label: Sassafras Knob
description: on Noland Divide, N Swain County in Great Smoky Mountains National Park between Lower and Upper Sassafras Gaps near lat. 35°32'03" N., long. 83°27'10" W. Alt. 4,665.

label: Sassafras Mountain
description: on the Jackson-Transylvania County line SW of Bearpen Mountain. Alt. 4,347.

label: Sassafras Ridge
description: E Haywood County between Buckeye Cove and Beaverdam Creek.

label: Sassafras Ridge
description: S Macon County between Nantahala River and Nantahala Mountains.

label: Savannah Creek
description: rises in E Anson County and flows NE into Blewett Falls Lake.

label: Sawmill Branch
description: rises in NE Buncombe County and flows N into Carter Creek.

label: Sawmill Creek
description: rises in N Lincoln County and flows SE to join Lippard Creek in forming Leepers Creek.

label: Sawmill Creek
description: rises in S Swain County and flows NW and then SW into Little Tennessee River.

label: Sawyer Creek
description: rises in N central Graham County and flows NE into Little Tennessee River.

label: Sawyers Creek
description: rises in N central Camden County and flows S into Pasquotank River. Settlements existed at its mouth prior to 1677. See also Grays Mill.

label: Scaly Mountain
description: S Macon County between the head of Middle Creek and the head of Piney Knob Fork. Alt. 4,804.

label: School House Branch
description: rises in W Carteret County and flows SW into Hadnot Creek.

label: Schoolhouse Branch
description: rises in NE Cherokee County and flows SE into Junaluska Creek.

label: Schoolhouse Branch
description: rises in S Haywood County and flows SW into Little East Fork Pigeon River.

label: Scotland Neck
description: town in SE Halifax County. Named for region settled 1722 by Scottish colonists. Inc. 1867. Produces textiles. Alt. 103.

label: Scott Creek
description: rises in central Alexander County and flows W into Glade Creek.

label: Scott Creek
description: rises in E Beaufort County and flows SE into Pungo Creek.

label: Scott Creek
description: rises in central Craven County and flows N into Neuse River at James City.

label: Scott Creek
description: rises in NE Jackson County N of Judaculla Mountain and flows SW through the towns of Sylva and Dillsboro to empty into Tuckasegee River just W of Dillsboro.

label: Scotts Store
description: community in N Duplin County. Named for local storeowner, A. J. Scott.

label: Scuppernong Township
description: NW Tyrrell County.

label: Second Creek
description: rises in W Randolph County and flows E into Uwharrie River.

label: Second Creek
description: community on the creek of the same name in N central Tyrrell County.

label: Second Creek
description: rises in E Tyrrell County and flows SE into Alligator River. Called Third Creek on the Collet map, 1770. Approx. 4½ mi. long and ¾ mi. wide at its mouth.

label: Seven Mile Ridge
description: N Haywood County, extends N parallel to McGinty Creek.

label: Shady Grove
description: community in NW Caswell County.

label: Shallow Ford
description: in Little Tennessee River in N Macon County.

label: Shallow Ford
description: passage through the Yadkin River, SE Yadkin County and SW Forsyth County. The main W road from the early Moravian settlements crossed there, and it is mentioned in records as early as 1767. Site of military encounters in both Revolutionary and Civil Wars.

label: Sharon
description: community in NW Camden County. Named for a Methodist church erected there in 1894. Previously known as Slab Ridge. Alt. 18.

label: Sharon
description: community in S Cleveland County.

label: Sharon
description: community in W Iredell County.

label: Shaw Creek
description: rises in SW Anson County and flows S into Deadfall Creek.

label: Sheep Island
description: a tidal-marsh island just inside Lockwoods Folly Inlet, S central Brunswick County.

label: Sheep Knob
description: N Buncombe County NW of Courthouse Knob.

label: Sheep Knob
description: S Cherokee County on the NW end of Moccasin Mountain.

label: Sheep Knob
description: N Cleveland County.

label: Sheep Knob
description: W Jackson County near the head of East Fork [Savannah Creek]. Alt. 4,784.

label: Sheep Knob
description: E Macon County between Caler Fork and Cowee Creek.

label: Sheep Mountain
description: E Haywood County between Rock Hollow and Jordan Branch.

label: Sheep Mountain
description: N Jackson County between Black Mountain and Moses Creek.

label: Shell Point
description: the SE point of Harkers Island in SE Carteret County. Mound of shells, apparently left by Indians, gave the point its name. Indian remains have been found there.

label: Shelton Branch
description: rises in N Buncombe County and flows NW into Paint Fork. See also Anderson Cove.

label: Shepherd Branch
description: rises in N Buncombe County and flows SW into Flat Creek.

label: Shepherd Creek
description: rises in N Macon County and flows S into Cowee Creek.

label: Shepherd Mountain
description: W Henderson County on South Fork.

label: Shepherd Mountain
description: N Mitchell County between Bean Creek and Spring Creek.

label: Sherrill Gap
description: central Swain County between Bryson Branch and Lands Creek.

label: Sherrills Ford
description: across Catawba River between Catawba and Iredell Counties. Named for Adam Sherrill, trailblazer in the settlement of W North Carolina who crossed the Catawba River there in 1747. The passage over the river was used by troops during the Revolutionary War. The site is now under the waters of Lake Norman. The name appears on various maps dating from the eighteenth century through 1963.

label: Sherwood
description: community in S Cumberland County served by post office, 1883-1907.

label: Shiloh
description: town in SW Camden County. Inc. 1883, but no long active in municipal affairs. Daniel Billet settled there before 1694, and the name "Billet's Bridge" is still known locally at the site of a bridge that he built. Named Danson's Manor after 1696, when 3,640 acres were granted to John Danson, son-in-law of Governor John Archdale. Danson never lived there, but his heirs held the property until 1739. In the middle of the eighteenth century, the place came to be called Mill Town for a group of watermills erected on a bluff overlooking the Pasquotank River. Shortly after 1800, the local Baptist church (organized 1729), the oldest Baptist church in the state, changed its name to Shiloh, and the name came to be applied to the community.

label: Shiloh
description: community in NW Rockingham County. Named for Shiloh Primitive Baptist Church. Earlier name for the area was Spring Garden, which see.

label: Shiloh Township
description: S Camden County.

label: Shoal Creek
description: rises in SE Buncombe County and flows NW into Cane Creek.

label: Shoal Creek
description: rises in NE Burke County and flows N into Catawba River.

label: Shoal Creek
description: rises in W Cherokee County between Signal Pole Hill and Arp Gap and flows NE into Apalachia Lake on Hiwassee River. Sometimes known as South Shoal Creek.

label: Shoal Creek
description: rises in SW Henderson County and flows NW into Crab Creek.

label: Shoal Creek
description: rises in NW Jackson County and flows NW into Soco Creek.

label: Shoal Creek
description: rises in S Jackson County and flows NW into West Fork Tuckasegee River.

label: Shoal Creek
description: rises in S Macon County and flows SW into Middle Creek.

label: Shoal Creek
description: rises in S Transylvania County and flows NE into Middle Fork French Broad River.

label: Shoal Creek
description: rises in W Transylvania County and flows SW to join Indian Creek in forming North Fork French Broad River.

label: Shoal Mountain
description: W Jackson County between Thorpe Reservoir and Shoal Creek.

label: Shoofly
description: community in W Granville County between Culbreth and Stem.

label: Shooting Creek
description: rises in SE Clay County and flows W into Lake Chatuge on the Hiwassee River. The name is believed to be a translation of the Cherokee du-stagalan'yi (where it made a great noise), applied to the stream.

label: Shop Branch
description: rises in NE Cherokee County and flows NW into Worm Creek.

label: Shop Branch
description: rises in W Johnston County and flows SE into Middle Creek.

label: Short Off
description: peak in NW Clay County near the Cherokee-Clay county line. Probably named for C. W. Short (1794-1863), American botanist.

label: Shortoff Mountain
description: W Burke County. Alt. approx. 3,115.

label: Shut-in Creek
description: rises in N Jackson County on N slopes of Bald Mountain and flows N into Soco Creek.

label: Sidney
description: community in E Beaufort County.

label: Silas Creek
description: rises in NW Ashe County and flows SE into North Fork New River.

label: Silas Creek
description: rises in SW Beaufort County and flows N into Chocowinity Bay, Pamlico River.

label: Silas Creek
description: rises in NW Forsyth County and flows SW into Muddy Creek. Known earlier as Spangenberg Creek for Bishop August G. Spangenberg, who led a surveying party from Edenton to the Blue Ridge Mountains in 1752 in search of a suitable site for a Moravian settlement. Spangenberg Creek appears as Strangenbergs Creek on the Collet map, 1770, and as Spanking Back on the Price map, 1808. By 1833, when the MacRae map appeared, it was called Silas Creek. Reynolda Lake is on Silas Creek.

label: Sills Creek
description: rises in N Pender County and flows NE into Sawyers Creek.

label: Silver Creek
description: rises in NW Burke County and flows SE into Rose Creek.

label: Silver Creek
description: rises in SW Burke County and flows NE into Catawba River.

label: Silver Creek
description: rises in SE Caldwell County and flows SE into Gunpowder Creek.

label: Silver Creek
description: rises in central Polk County and flows N into Lake Adger on Green River.

label: Silver Hill
description: community in S central Davidson County between Fourmile Branch and head of Battle Branch. A mine operated there almost continuously from about 1838 until 1860; produced lead, gold, and silver.

label: Silver Hill
description: community in W Pamlico County. Named for local Silver family.

label: Silver Lake
description: tidal basin or boat harbor, 700 yds. long, at the community of Ocracoke on Ocracoke Island, SE Hyde County.

label: Silver Lake
description: a natural lake fed by springs, SW New Hanover County between Todds and Barnards Creeks near the Cape Fear River. Covers approx. 16 acres; max. depth 30 ft.

label: Silver Run Creek
description: rises in S Jackson County on the SE slope of Chimneytop Mountain and flows SW 3 mi. to join Little Whitewater Creek in forming Whitewater River.

label: Silvermine Branch
description: rises in NE Cherokee County and flows SE into Valley River.

label: Silvermine Branch
description: rises in N Madison County and flows SW into French Broad River.

label: Simmons Branch
description: rises in S Madison County and flows SE into Sandy Mush Creek.

label: Simmons Branch
description: rises in NE Swain County and flows SE into Raven Fork.

label: Sitton Creek
description: rises in NW Henderson County and flows SW into Seniard Creek.

label: Slade Creek
description: rises in SW Hyde County and flows NW and SW into Pungo River. Appears on the Collet map, 1770.

label: Sleepy Creek
description: rises in SE Carteret County between the communities of Gloucester and Marshallberg and flows S approx. 1½ mi. into The Straits. Appears on the Collet map, 1770.

label: Slick Rock
description: elevation between the head of Norton Branch and the head of Cane Creek in SE Macon County approx. 3 mi. SE of town of Highlands. Alt. approx. 3,340.

label: Slickrock Branch
description: rises in N Cherokee County near Bearpen Gap and flows NE into Hyatt Creek.

label: Slickrock Branch
description: rises in N Haywood County and flows SE into Pigeon River.

label: Sloan
description: community in SE Duplin County served by post office, 1884-1920. Alt. 50.

label: Smith Branch
description: rises in S central Cabarrus County and flows NE into Coddle Creek.

label: Smith Branch
description: rises in E Madison County and flows S into Little Creek.

label: Smith Creek
description: rises in E Anson County near the town of Lilesville and flows NE into Blewett Falls Lake.

label: Smith Creek
description: rises in E Beaufort County and flows SE into Pungo Creek.

label: Smith Creek
description: rises in central Buncombe County and flows NE into French Broad River.

label: Smith Creek
description: rises in SE Granville County and flows W 7 mi. into Beaverdam Creek at the Granville-Wake county line.

label: Smith Creek
description: rises in W Hyde County and flows N into Pungo River. Appears as Smiths Creek on the Collet map, 1770.

label: Smith Creek
description: rises in N Pamlico County and flows SE into Bay River.

label: Smith Creek
description: rises in SE Pamlico County and flows S into the Greens Creek estuary at Neuse River. Appears on the Moseley map, 1733.

label: Smith's Creek
description: See Oriental.

label: Smiths Creek
description: rises in NE Davie County and flows E approx. 6 mi. into Carters Creek.

label: Smiths Creek
description: rises in W Lee County and flows N into Deep River.

label: Smiths Creek
description: rises in N New Hanover County and flows SW into Cape Fear River.

label: Smiths Store
description: community in NW Cabarrus County.

label: Smiths Township
description: former township in E Cabarrus County, now township no. 9.

label: Smyrna Township
description: on Core Sound and Jarrett Bay in E Carteret County. At one time, parts of Smyrna made up Carteret and no. 6 and 7 townships.

label: Snake Knob
description: N central Avery County.

label: Snake Knob
description: N Yancey County between Little Creek and Bald Mountain Creek.

label: Snakeden Ridge
description: W Swain County, extends E from Pinnacle Creek to Pinnacle Ridge.

label: Snow Creek
description: rises in N Catawba County and flows NE into Catawba River.

label: Snow Creek
description: community in N central Iredell County. Developed around a Methodist church founded there in 1802 at a cemetery begun in the 1780s.

label: Snow Creek
description: rises on Asbury Mountain, NE Alexander County, and flows SE into W central Iredell County, where it enters South Yadkin River.

label: Snow Creek
description: rises in N Stokes County and flows SE into Dan River.

label: Snow Creek
description: rises in W Surry County and flows SE and S into Mitchell River.

label: Snow Creek Township
description: S central Mitchell County.

label: Snow Hill
description: community in N Chowan County.

label: Snowbird Creek
description: rises in SW Graham County and flows SE and NE into Santeetlah Lake. Called Titiyi (snowbird place) by Indians.

label: Snyder Creek
description: rises in NE Cherokee County and flows NW into Tatham Creek.

label: Soapstone Branch
description: rises in NW Henderson County in Pisgah National Forest and flows E into McDowell Creek.

label: Soapstone Branch
description: rises in E Mitchell County and flows W into Left Fork [Cane Creek].

label: Soapstone Gap
description: E Haywood County between Mary Gray Knob and Wines Top. Alt. 3,640.

label: Soapstone Ridge
description: extends SE from Three Forks Mountain in W Transylvania County to Catheys Creek in W central Transylvania County.

label: Soco Creek
description: rises near Soco Gap, W Haywood County, and flows NE into Jonathans Creek.

label: Soco Falls
description: on Soco Creek, W Haywood County. Water falls in a double stream over a series of rocky ledges for about 60 ft. into a cuplike basin. Said to have been named by the Cherokees for their word Sog-wah (one).

label: Sodom Branch
description: rises in NW Madison County near Sodom Mountain and flows N into Big Laurel Creek.

label: Somerset
description: community in SE Chowan County served by post office, 1888-1903.

label: South Creek
description: rises in SE Beaufort County and flows N and E into Pamlico River. Appears as Chickorack River on the Comberford map, 1657, and as South Dividing Creek on the Collet map, 1770.

label: South Creek
description: rises in E Chatham County and flows E and S into Wake County, where it enters Big White Oak Creek near the Chatham County line.

label: South Creek
description: rises in NE Rutherford County and flows NE into First Broad River.

label: South Fork
description: rises in S Forsyth County and flows SW into Davidson County, where it enters Muddy Creek a short distance S of the county line. Early Moravian settlers called it Ens Creek, and it appears as such on the Collet map, 1770. On the Price map, 1808, it is marked "Ens or South Fork."

label: South Fork
description: rises in S Henderson County and flows NW into Willow Creek. Also known locally as Greer Creek.

label: South Fork
description: rises in N McDowell County near Betsy and Hensley Ridges and flows SE into Toms Creek.

label: South Fork
description: rises in NW McDowell County on the N slope of Pups Ridge and flows SE into Roses Creek.

label: South Fork
description: rises in W Surry County and flows SE into Mitchell River.

label: South Fork
description: rises in E Transylvania County and flows SE into W Henderson County, where it flows NE to join North Fork in forming Mills River. Sometimes also known as South Fork Mills River.

label: South Fork Creek
description: rises in W Tyrrell County and flows N into Scuppernong River.

label: South Fork Township
description: S Forsyth County.

label: South Lake
description: NW mainland of Dare County. It drains into Alligator River.

label: South Point
description: N extremity of Pea Island in E Dare County. Lies at junction of Oregon Inlet and Atlantic Ocean.

label: South Prong
